review_text: I have been to Pinstripes a handful of times but this time was for my wedding. We rented their whole basement venue and I have nothing but wonderful things to say about every staff person at Pinstripes. From the servers, to the chefs, to our amazing coordinator Laura Trahey, the whole team is top notch in my book. If looking for a wedding venue, Pinstripes may not be the first place you think of, but it should be the last place you should look and book. Their food, their venue, their service, amazing. We opted for the gelato bar and they decorated the buffet table it was on for a fall theme and it was beautiful. They kept going above and beyond we ever expected. We ate cheese and prosciutto/fig flatbread, meatball sliders, chopped salad, pear salad, short ribs, garlic mashed potatoes, chicken Parmesan, Italian jambalaya, cookies, brownies, apple bread pudding- ALL AMAZING!!

review_text: This place is just super cool.  We were in Chicago for a weekend and wanted a cool--that is, air conditioned--place to hang out.  We only had drinks, so I can't speak to the food, but the fact that they have indoor bocce ball should make this a go-to place.The servers were attentive and friendly, and did I mention they have indoor bocce ball?

review_text: came to pinstripes last Thursday. We walked in around 8:30 letting the host know that we want to bowl. She said the next lane will be available at 9 so we waited around. It's actually super nice and classy inside. I have been to the pinstripes in Northbrook/Glenview and the chicago location is a lot nicer looking. Fast forward to 9PM we got to our lanes, sat down ordered some food and started to bowl. I'm pretty sure we had a different server then we started with but he was super nice. We ordered fries, bruchetta and a fig and prosciutto pizza. I really enjoyed everything except the pizza ( I just didnt think it was anything special).  It was fun doing something in the city outside of just sitting at a restaurant/bar. I am surprised though that pinstripes wasn't as lively as I expected. Not sure if I will be back, I really was not too impressed. (side note: I previously worked for Brunswick Corporate in the bowling division and I assisted in the launch of a few high end bowling centers and I really did not think that Pinstripes was anything extraordinary)

review_text: Finally visited Pinstripes for a birthday dinner. To be honest, I am not sure what all the rave is about. I actually prefer King's. The food here is decent at best. The drinks are cloyingly sweet. The pricing is horrible for what you get. I chose to get full off of their appetizers because none of their actual entrees sounded or looked appealing to me (aside from the steak trio). I opted for the stuffed mushrooms and the tenderloin sliders. The mushrooms themselves definitely lacked in flavor. I wish they had been roasted in some sort of balsamic glaze. They seemed to only have been dusted with a conservative amount of salt, and then stuffed. The stuffing was okay - nothing special.What made this review a 3 star instead of a 2 star were the tenderloin sliders. These were arguably the three most tender pieces of beef I've ever had - FULL of flavor. I LOVED the sauce that came on the bun. It tasted of barbecue and onion. The bun pairing was genius. Reminiscent of Hawaiian sweet rolls and extremely moist. I was super disappointed with the potato strings. They were DROWNED in truffle oil rendering them inedible. Our waiter , I think his name was Jeremy , did a fantastic job juggling a party of over 20 guests. We had the fellow running all over the place getting this, taking that, and not once did this stop him from providing quality customer service. Pat on the back to Jeremy!

review_text: Dined at Pinstripes for the 4th of July. Pre-paid dinner $79, 4- course meal, taxes & gratuity included. Awesome views of the fireworks away from the rowdy crowds is well worth it & we left stuffed! Warning, the building is near the Pier, so you may want to wait for a couple of hours before leaving the building. Got there a little before 730PM & was seated on the patio within minutes. Our server was great from beginning to end, made sure we were enjoying ourselves & made sure to tell us not to rush anything since fireworks started at 930PM. We got bread upon sitting. Alcoholic beverages-of course- were not included, but that was expected. Got a bottle of Rose for the table. Very light & crisp! Perfect for the muggy weather! First course-- assorted cheese & meat plate enough for our party of 4. Enjoyed that thoroughly, nothing was left on the plate!Second course-- Salad with yummy watermelon slices. Finished every last bite of that too.Third course-- had a choice between Salmon & Steak Medallions, 3/4 of the table chose the steak, although the Salmon (I heard) was very well cooked. Came w/ 3 generous portions of steak with different toppings. Best one I'd say was the peppercorn, then the parmesan & lastly the gorgonzola. Sides were plenty of grilled asparagus & creamy mashed potatoes. Fourth course-- We got the house made gelato (cookies & cream) PLUS the Mango Sorbet, both very delicious in their own rights.By the time dessert rolled around, the fireworks were already blasting off. Our server offered to take a pic of us with the fireworks in the background & advised us to get closer. She was awesome! Enjoyed her service, the fireworks show & of course the food. It was such a lovely evening!

review_text: I have been here twice. Once to play bocce ball and have drinks and then again last night to watch the World Series game. My first experience was fine we just played bocce ball and hung out. Nothing spectacular but not bad either. Last night we returned and were able to get a table in the bar area to watch the game. We had a wonderful waitress who was very nice and always made sure we had everything we needed. I cannot remember her name. We ordered drinks- all good and then some spinach dip. It was excellent it stayed hot the whole time and was delicious. We also ordered some flatbreads. The BBQ chicken was excellent, my favorite. The chicken avocado flatbread was a little plain and needed some extra taste to it. We had a good time and good food.

review_text: *** NOTE: Check in on Yelp to get a free gelato or sorbet ***Couldn't make happy hour, so we made reservations for 6:30pm on a Friday night when happy hour ends (insert crying emoji). We were hoping to sit in the patio, and the staff confirmed an hour prior to the reservation that we could sit out there. However, every table on the patio was full when we got there at 6:30pm for our reservation. We were given the option to sit inside or outside by the entrance of Pinstripes (not the same as the patio, Pinstripes, not the same).This place is massive. There's the patio, indoor dining area, kitchen, bowling alley, bocce area, and bar. It's a fun and modern atmosphere. We didn't get to check out bowling or bocce unfortunately and can only speak of the dining experience.I ordered the Maple Glazed Salmon, which has organic quinoa, cucumber, avocado, tomato, pesto, and red pepper. I had a bemused expression when the server asked how I wanted the salmon cooked. I'm so used to being asked that question when ordering steak that it just completely threw me off. I decided on medium-well. The dish turned out to be delicious! The flavors just worked so well together, and the salmon was perfectly cooked. It is a bit pricey though at $27. I wonder if that's why prices aren't advertised on the website? I also had the sorbet dessert, which was sweet. Not the best sorbet I had, but it was okay.Our waitress was great. She was friendly, attentive, and made sure to accommodate for my food allergies. In fact, the receipt even stated to remove the ingredients I was allergic to!I think I need to come back during happy hour to get a taste of that menu and dine in the patio area.

review_text: While being touristy in Chicago with my boyfriend and his mom, we came to Pinstripes because it was within walking distance from Navy Pier and the Ogilvie train station. It was a solid find! It's got an upscale twist on bar games with bowling, bocce, and decidedly not-bar-quality food. Unfortunately we didn't have time to enjoy a round of bocce before heading back to our train, but we did enjoy a leisurely meal. On our way in we were given cards good for a free appetizer with entree purchase. Being Wisconsinites, we opted for the fried mozzarella. What's a meal without cheese, after all? It appeared they breaded and fried mozzarella pearls which made for a nice bite-sized snack without the unmanageable strings of melted cheese sticks tend to result in. For my lunch I went for the Grilled Chicken Club. It was really tasty for the most part except for the bites that were heavy on the charbroil and/or fennel. A little fennel put an interesting spin on the common chicken/bacon/avocado combination, but a big bite of fennel was overwhelming for me. The matchstick fries were crispy and delicious and I wish I'd had room to eat more. My boyfriend enjoyed his Famous Prime Rib Dip and his mom loved her Chicken & Goat Cheese pasta. When I checked in on the Yelp app I saw I got a free scoop of gelato or seasonal sorbet. My lunch companions had stopped at Ben & Jerry's before but I wanted to wait to see what else we discovered - glad I did! I had my choice between mandarin sorbet or mint gelato. I picked the mint and was delivered three scoops in a bowl - enough for all of us. The staff didn't know my table mates had already enjoyed a sweet treat, so I greatly appreciated them taking us all into account. The gelato had thin mint cookies chunks throughout and was served with two as garnish. The mint itself was light and refreshing - definitely the product of real mint and not a bright green syrup.There was a slight snafu with being charged for our appetizer, but that was remedied pretty quickly. Our leftovers were boxed and bagged which made for easy transport on our ride home.

review_text: Pretty cool Pinstripes. They got bocce ball lanes, plenty of tables and chairs to wine and dine, and upstairs they have plenty of bowling lanes for all your bowling fanatics out there. Everything was in super nice condition; the shoes, lanes, bowling balls were all good. The computer touch-screens that were on our lane were a little finnicky, and the bowling pin setter machine was quick and fast after each frame.The food there was awesome. We ordered:CRISPY CALAMARI -- nice and crispy. I'm a tentacle person, and these were greatSPINACH & ARTICHOKE DIP -- decent. I really liked the pita chips/bread that came with thisSTUFFED MUSHROOMS  -- there was 4 to an order. Pretty good, the mushrooms were stuffed with a concoction of zucchini, goat cheese, artichoke, sundried tomato, roasted red pepperFRIED MOZZARELLA -- not mozzarella sticks, mind you, but mozza balls on a bed of lettuceBARBEQUE CHICKEN PIZZA -- delicious, crispy crust, although the chicken could have been more YELLOWFIN TUNA FLATBREAD -- absolute star of the show. If there's one appetizer you gotta get, its this!ANTIPASTO & CHEESE PLATTER -- a smorgasbord of imported italian meat, housemade lamb sausage, variety of cheeses, accompanimentsThe drinks were strong enough, and they had a decent Happy Hour selection. I stuck with Old Fashions, cuz I'm an old fashion, Don Draper wannabe guy. The waitstaff were super accommodating to our party of 15 and when I asked if any of the dishes had nuts, the server didn't know for sure, but he made it a mission for himself to go out of his way to get several waiters/staff to look over our spread and make sure we were all good. Excellent service!BATHROOM REVIEW: There's a private mens/women bathroom on the top floor near the bowling lanes. I went to the one downstairs in the dungeon, where there were separated mens and womens bathrooms. In the mens bathroom, inside there were several urinals and stalls, and they were all super clean. The sinks were a-plenty and they were all hands-free, including the paper-towel dispenser. Super clean and well kept. Sit or squat? Sit!

review_text: I might go back here to try bowling, but the service left a lot to be desired.We had lunch there on a weekend, and it took almost an hour and a half - this was at maybe 25% capacity. Our waiter was nice but had no idea how to answer our questions about the food. It took about 45 minutes for the soup to come out, but when it did, another waiter stood awkwardly at the other patio table for a few minutes with our soups. After that, we got our soups, and we also got our (overpriced but good) entrees at the same time. There was absolutely zero coordination, and it looked like very little training. Our waiter forgot lots of things, too, like a glass for my friend's beer. He would be gone for 15-20 minutes at a time, and the place was hardly slammed. The bocce was nice enough. The entire place is clean and well designed, apart for only one bathroom on the main level. I know this review seems a bit humorless, but it's frustrating that a place that tries to bill itself as so upscale and ~*~atypically nice~*~ has such issues with lunch service for maybe 10 tables (this includes inside and outside).

review_text: Eat, drink and play. 3 in 1 at Pinstripes. It's a gigantic restaurant located on the Chicago River in the historic River East Arts Center. Very modern and open. They offer a bowling room for both individuates and groups for all age, perfect for family as well. they also have another fun and interesting sport, Bocce, if you now how to play or just want to learn. It looks very fun. Who knows how to play Bocce, hit me up and let's go. I like to try new things.Both sports are very inexpensive. The bowling price starts as low as $8/hour. The Bocce starts as low as $5/hour. Bowling shoes ($5)are required and are charged per person but it includes complimentary Pinstripes socks, that's great.Separate menu at the bar section and for dinning room. so much to choose from. The price is so reasonable. They have a big wine selection for the wine loves. I love their happy hour menu, some of the appetizers are half off and as low as $4 every Monday through Friday from 3 to 6:30 pm. Now, you know when to come and catch me, LOL.  I go there for happy hour and happy tummy. Great service and fun atmosphere. Highly recommended for a fun day with friends. In the summer they will open up their gorgeous patio with a beautiful river view/city view. I love hanging out with friends and enjoy my wine there. Can't wait for the weather to get better. I miss that quality time.

review_text: I came here for Sunday buffet brunch and the food was fantastic! Definitely bring a big appetite and try everything. The buffet price also includes one mimosa. There was nothing on my plate I didn't like/finish and service was attentive, hence the five stars. They make a little of everything. There's an omelette station, a waffle station, breakfast sausage, smoked salmon, shrimp cocktail, prime rib, roasted turkey, salads, baked goods, chicken tenders, grilled veggies, pasta, fresh fruit, and a chocolate fountain with all the goodies for dipping. The cheesecake at their chocolate fountain station was heavenly good.I don't usually order waffles when I go out, so I had to take advantage and try their mini waffles, which they make to order. Oh my, they were the best waffles I have ever tasted. The waffle was so fragrant, pillowy soft and slightly sweet from soaking up the syrup. They serve it with fresh whipped cream (choose among plain, balsamic, or NUTELLA) and fresh cut strawberries. I can't think of many things that can eat good old fresh whipped cream.

review_text: Happy hour review only!!!The details:-Monday thru Friday from 3pm to 6:30pm-$4 drafts, $4 house wines, & $5 premium wells-Select starters, pizzas & flatbreads at a reduced price-Available in the bar, bocce, bowling, and patio areasAs advertised, they claim they were "voted Chicago's best happy hour" and rightfully so.  Tried the stuffed mushrooms, tenderloin sliders, and the chicken & avocado club flatbread. All of the food was excellent and worth the happy hour prices in my opinion. I think the only thing I can complain on is that their draft selection is limited to 6 craft brews. Service was great on this last visit when we sat at the bar front.Anyways, get yo drink on! 'Til next time, cheers!

review_text: We just celebrated my birthday dinner here last night. Although, my wife (party organizer) had some initial hiccups securing a room/space for our group of 15, the General Manager Ben came to her rescue and made sure that we had the option of sitting outside on their river facing patio or got a private room, if the weather didn't cooperate. Sadly, it was cloudy and chilly so we sat in the private room but our group had a great time. Service through out the night was excellent and our server was patient and gave us plenty of time to order apps and eventually dinner. Drink orders through out the night were timely and no one had to wait too long.Everything on the menu tasted great. Our table got calamari, various flatbreads, salads, bruschetta, sea bass, some pasta, ribs, risotto to name a few. Food was very good, not your typical bowling alley fare. This was gourmet! They were also great in letting my wife bring cup cakes and a bottle of champagne. They chilled the champagne and brought out 15 flutes when it was time to toast. Overall, we were very pleased and recommend this Pinstripes for your next night out, group or work celebration etc.

review_text: I was celebrating my friend's birthday yesterday at Pinstripes. We were a large group, but nonetheless, I expect to have at least decent service when I'm at a restaurant in Streeterville. If I was looking for bad service, I would have gone to a restaurant in Wrigleyville. Our waiter was not helpful by any means. Upon taking my order, I honestly did not have time to review the menu, so I decided to ask for some recommendations from your "trained associate." He asked me if I had a taste for anything in particular, and I replied "I do not, I'm quite flexible." His response, "Well, everything on the menu is good." I then replied, "Well that wasn't too helpful," because it wasn't. He then continued, "Well if you aren't going to give me any direction, I can't help you." I was so shocked with his response, I was actually quite offended. I gave him a $2 tip, when really I should have not given him anything. I'm still very bothered by this incident and do not plan on returning. I've already been informing my network of how terrible this establishment really is.

review_text: I've come here on a couple of occasions now and my thoughts on this place are overall positive, but mixed.The best time to go: happy hour! the appetizers and flatbreads are at a great price and the drinks are very value-based.the not so great time to go: brunch for the next two weeks. They're on a "holiday brunch" schedule which means it's $35/person AYCE + bottomless mimosas while it is normally $28. I'm not quite sure where the extra $7 came in. There was nothing that made me feel like "damn that was worth it." Yes, they had smoked salmon, yes they had prime rib, and yes they had endless mimosas. But if you're not a huge drinker, i think you'd be disappointed with the stale pizza, dry chicken fingers and overdressed salads. It was decent for the price but nothing I think I'll come back to anytime soon. On top of which, the wait staff seemed to really rush us to leave (asked if they could give us our checks while our plates and mimosa glasses were quite full on two occasions).Other than the food and service, though, the venue itself is quite the treasure. Clean, spacious, and fun!

review_text: We  had our wedding and reception at Pinstripes. Everything about it was wonderful. Our goals were for our big day to be memorable, for us to write the least number of checks possible, and we didn't want to go overboard trying to manage every last detail. The week of the wedding, we added a signature cocktail, champagne margaritas. Pinstripes was great in allowing us to come by on Friday (our wedding was Saturday) to try them. We had a ordered backdrop through Pinstripes for the ceremony. I dropped off place cards, signs and a gift box on Friday. Jessica and her team were wonderful and put these out for me on Saturday.They had a nice room for the whole bridal party to hang out in before the wedding. After the ceremony they flipped the room from ceremony to reception. Jessica and her team were nice enough to put out our centerpieces (we had wine bottles with flowers in them, I wasn't picky what vases and flowers went on which table). Right before dinner people weren't really taking their table cards, so they moved the table so that more people would get their table cards. Everyone said they had a fabulous time, the food was great and it was so fun to have the bocce ball court and extra bar area for people hang out in. We did gelato bar for dessert which was a huge hit. They brought out two bowls of gelato for us to feed one another much like one does a cake. Everyone else went out to the bar area to get gelato. At one point I saw at least 10 people in line to get gelato. We also had one person who was vegan and they did a great job accomidating him. I forgot to tell them what table he was at until we were about to do our enterance to the reception. Our friend was really impressed by the food (and the amount of it) that they brought him.

review_text: Easily one of my absolute favorite restaurants in Chicago. The Chicken Parm is fantastic and the green apple martini is amazing. One of these trips I will watch closely to figure out how they make them! The servers are great, bus boys are friendly, hostesses always have a smile. Their uniforms even are attractive for how simple they are. In the summer make sure you sit outside by the river.

review_text: Great food and good service (eventually). After bringing us some bread, our waiter never appeared again (I'm not sure the person who brought our bread was actually a waiter, as he never introduced himself). We waited a good 15 minutes before a waitress from another section came to check on us since we didn't even have any waters yet. She ended up comping a lobster bisque for each of us and it was delicious. My friend ordered the boneless short ribs and I ordered the shrimp, spinach, and tomato flatbread. Both were very delicious, especially the short ribs. Environment was causal and a little noisy but it wasn't bothersome.

review_text: Came here with some coworkers on a Wednesday for happy hour before seeing a movie. The place was pretty empty with the exception of the bar which filled up by the time we left at 630. Can't comment on the bowling, but the venue was really nice and clean (although the downstairs bathrooms were located in a very strange place- you have to go past offices and such to get there). Now onto the important stuff- food! Their happy hour is top notch! Half off apps , flatbreads, and $4/$5 wine and draft beers. Their wine and beer lists were both very impressive, my team, being beer snobs was impressed . We ordered a collection of apps and flatbreads-- the menu items are pretty standard with a view unique flatbreads (yellowfin tuna?) but the way they execute gives an extra unique taste. With that, no two people in our group had the same favorite. Some liked the spinach artichoke dip while others felt it wasn't thick enough, some loved the bbq chicken pizza where others felt it strayed too far from the norm. Mozzarella balls were all around enjoyed (but how do you mess that up?) and my personal favorite was the chicken avocado club pizza (sans bacon). We commented on how this would be an ideal date spot. Cheap drinks and apps for happy hour, and then if it's going well you can bowl but if not its separate enough that it's not awkward if you don't! It also appeared there was a nice back patio with fire places- was too cold to check out but looked nice! I'd come back.

review_text: The River East Building has not had good luck with restaurants.... so this review is strictly on the restaurant.Upon entering this massive restaurant, I had noticed how cool this restaurant is with the exposed beams, brick walls, wooden floor and the brightness of this space is.  We were seated right away since we were having a late lunch.  We had opted to have a booth.  There are various seating configurations to accommodate everyone.George had greeted with a great smile and personality.  He went over the menu with us then proceeded with our drink order.  Everything looked really good. George had brought us our drinks then took our order. I had ordered the loaded mac n' cheese (I tend to judge a restaurant on this item).  My companions had ordered the Salmon Sandwich and the Prosciutto Sandwich.  We also had ordered three cups of the chicken dumpling soup since it was a cool day.  The soups were brought to us right away.  The soup was very good.  Then shortly, the food runner had brought our main courses.  We had sampled each other meals and none of us had any negative thing to say.  The Mac N' Cheese was one of the best I've ever tasted.  I've had some bad Mac N' Cheese.Throughout our meal and dessert/coffee, George was great.   He really added a great experience.  After our meal, we take a tour of this complex of restaurant and bowling and bocce areas.  The areas looked really spotless.  The restaurant has an incredible patio over looking the river.  If it's cool night, don't worry, there are blankets and several fire pits to keep you warmI would highly recommend this place.  Looking forward to my next visit.

review_text: This restaurant is great! The service was amazing. I made a reservation for a group of 15 a few weeks beforehand over the phone although their online reservation system said it was unavailable. They also made me a bowling reservation for two hours for two lanes. It was a pretty slow night so even though we were seated right away, our entire group didn't come until 40 min late but they didn't complain at all. We started with drinks, some yummy bread and a pineapple upside down shot recommended by our awesome server, Jeremy. He even let us split checks which made life so much easier. Bless him! Some Chicago restaurants give you so much attitude if you even ask. On to the food! I tried a few dishes:Italian beef pizza- huge! Can be shared with two peopleJambalaya- delish!Chicken and goat cheese pizza- the best!!Bowling was a lot of fun and I loved the free pinstripes socks! The waitress was super nice and not overbearing. We loved this place! I'd definitely recommend it for a big group to do a fun activity instead of just a meal.

review_text: Went to Pinstripes with a group of 9 to celebrate a birthday on Saturday night. We had a dinner reservation at 5:30, but the restaurant was pretty empty at that hour. The first floor of Pinstripes is really nice, with a receptionist desk in front, a large bar/lounge area and then the general seating area. There's outdoor space as well overlooking the river.Food overall was good. I had the spicy chicken sandwich and enjoyed it. The Italian jambalaya looked really good as did the chicken parm. The lasagna was a rather small portion. My primary complaint is everything was pretty expensive. The food was good but let's not pretend Pinstripes is a Piccolo Sogno or Siena Tavern...We ended up paying for 2 hours of bocci ball downstairs. The courts are great and a server came around regularly taking our drink orders. Again my complaint is cost. Saturday night bocci was $10/hour/person. I realize we had a ton of people for one court/game but $90/hour for bocci for the group? Feels like a rip off.This is a really neat place, and I had a great time, it's just really expensive to fully take advantage of everything they had. Definitely a once and a great while type of place for me.

review_text: I've been coming here for happy hour after the movies at AMC River East. And enjoying it. The restaurant part is actually quite nice, with a nice looking dining room and outdoor patio. The bowling lanes are way off to the side in another area, so it's not like eating in a bowling alley, and the bocce court looks like fun. But for me the only exercise is raising a cocktail glass. So find me in the bar area. The bar has comfortable seating and there are high top tables if you prefer. Service is friendly, and my Manhattan was well-made. No complaints there. The happy hour specials are really appealing. Wine and beer for $4, half-price appetizers, and great flat breads for $7. Chicken + avocado flatbread had a good crust and was tasty (it's a "club" so tell them to hold the bacon if you don't want it). My friend's pepperoni flatbread suited him to a T. The filet mignon trio with mashed and asparagus was a decent entree, but this is no steakhouse. Like I said, a very serviceable happy hour. Just be sure to get your orders in before 6:30!

review_text: Pinstripes catered our engagement party this past weekend and did a great job.  We had 64 people and the perfect amount of food.  A manager and server showed up on time and organized. I highly recommend Pinstripes if you are looking for catering.

review_text: Went to Pinstripes for Sunday Brunch with my fianc and we were really impressed! From the omelets, waffles (the toppings they offered for the waffles were both delicious and plentiful btw) to the fresh fruit...can't forget the bacon... Oh and mimosas...everything was tasty! We sat on the patio on a warm day and really enjoyed that as well. The ambience was nice and it was so peaceful. We kinda expected a crowd due to the fact that it was a Sunday and a warm one at that, but that wasn't the case. I had previously heard of some people saying that their service wasn't great but we personally had no issues as everyone we encountered was kind. I would definitely recommend this spot for brunch. 4.5 would be my true rating.

review_text: I've been coming here for happy hour after the movies at AMC River East. And enjoying it. The restaurant part is actually quite nice, with a nice looking dining room and outdoor patio. The bowling lanes are way off to the side in another area, so it's not like eating in a bowling alley, and the bocce court looks like fun. But for me the only exercise is raising a cocktail glass. So find me in the bar area. The bar has comfortable seating and there are high top tables if you prefer. Service is friendly, and my Manhattan was well-made. No complaints there. The happy hour specials are really appealing. Wine and beer for $4, half-price appetizers, and great flat breads for $7. Chicken + avocado flatbread had a good crust and was tasty (it's a "club" so tell them to hold the bacon if you don't want it). My friend's pepperoni flatbread suited him to a T. The filet mignon trio with mashed and asparagus was a decent entree, but this is no steakhouse. Like I said, a very serviceable happy hour. Just be sure to get your orders in before 6:30!

review_text: Pinstripes catered our engagement party this past weekend and did a great job.  We had 64 people and the perfect amount of food.  A manager and server showed up on time and organized. I highly recommend Pinstripes if you are looking for catering.

review_text: Went to Pinstripes for Sunday Brunch with my fianc and we were really impressed! From the omelets, waffles (the toppings they offered for the waffles were both delicious and plentiful btw) to the fresh fruit...can't forget the bacon... Oh and mimosas...everything was tasty! We sat on the patio on a warm day and really enjoyed that as well. The ambience was nice and it was so peaceful. We kinda expected a crowd due to the fact that it was a Sunday and a warm one at that, but that wasn't the case. I had previously heard of some people saying that their service wasn't great but we personally had no issues as everyone we encountered was kind. I would definitely recommend this spot for brunch. 4.5 would be my true rating.

review_text: Looking for a cool place to lounge while playing some bocce or bowling.. You found your spot! Right when you walk in it seems like a cool huge wine bar.. Then you go further and there's a restaurant, patio (with a great view) and then some bowling and bocce!  So much fun!!! Not only are the drinks amazing like the Moscow mule or grapefruit n vodka the food  n dessert is on point!  Got to try some pizza, the toppings and crust were perfect and the dessert was to die for! review_text: We E xpected more. Our bowling balls weren't coming back and we had to go to shelf to grab more until it ran out of our sizes. We eventually went to the front desk but there were no employees. We waited and waited, no one came. We had to go to an employee while they were cleaning tables. The manager, I suppose, came said he'd fix it and add more minutes. We waited 10 minutes just for someone to come. And it took another 10 minutes for them to fix. Turns out, the manager only gave me 10 minutes! TEN MINUTES. We wasted half an hour because it was so much of an hassle? Everything resets SO slow. Our friends and I expected way more out of a bowling bowl located in Downtown. We only got one lane! The bowling center at UIC is way cheaper, provides us with two lanes, and has better customer service. We would never come again.

review_text: First came to Pinstripes for a company event, where we had a few hours to bowl, mingle, and enjoy lots of food to share come right to our lanes. The flatbreads we tried had great combinations of ingredients and all of them were absolutely delicious. The servers are very attentive and continued to ask our party if we needed anything. Definitely a classy twist on the normal bowling alleys I've been too. However, the one downfall is that there are two lanes per each seating area. So if you don't want to feel like you are on top of the other party playing in the lane next to you, it might be best for your party to reserve both lanes. They also charge by the hour and not by the game, so we felt like we had to rush a bit and even ended up having to end a game in the middle (unless we had paid for an additional hour).

review_text: After visiting the Navy Pier-glad we did not eat there!We happened upon Pinstripes on a cold rainy day in Chicago.We had a great time for lunch. We ate first. We had the soup special -Chicken Tortilla-outstanding. Flavorful and loaded with chicken and veggies! I also had the small Caesar salad with grilled shrimp. Shrimp were warm and the salad was cold. Tossed with house made dressing.My son had the  1/2 rack of ribs and side of mac and cheese. He loved them. So much he would not share!!!My wife had the Italian Grinder and cup of the creamy tomato soup. Both were tasteful and well made. Perfect meal for that day.Our server Adam H. did a great job-friendly and helpful. Glad to have had him as our server.Then we played an hour worth of Bocce ball. Pinstripes helped us learn the rule and we had a blast. Well worth the visit and will be back!

review_text: This is my first one star review and it is not about the place but about the management team in Pinstripes in Streeterville.Last Saturday it was my best friend's birthday and we decided to watch fireworks from the restaurant's patio and have drinks and snacks with friends. On Tuesday I talked to the manager, Spencer, who told me that he could definitely help us out with this reservation outside. Next day my friend came back and made a reservation. She picked 2 high tops at the very end of the patio for 12 people on Saturday night at 9pm. The manager assured her that if we come on time there would be no problem with anything. She also asked if she needed to make any kind of payment to make sure to keep these tables, but nothing was required. On Saturday in the afternoon we got a call from pinstripes saying that the reservation will be pushed to 9:30pm. We said okay, because the fireworks did not start until 10:15. But. At 9 pm when we were already dressed up and all the guests were on the way we got another call saying that our reservation is cancelled and they can't accommodate us with the sitting outside. We were talking to some other manager whose name I unfortunately do not recall and he said that he can't give us anything outside because of two prepaid private events. He offered us to get a table inside which of course made completely no sense for us. In short, my complain is not about cancelling the reservation but the way it was cancelled ten minutes prior to our arrival! That's absolutely unacceptable! They didn't give us any time for a back up plan! I don't believe that the whole team was not aware of these prepaid private events at least couple DAYS before. Worse comes to worse they could have cancelled it with the first call in the afternoon but not the very last minute. I just don't understand how people can do it without thinking. They knew we asked for outside, they knew it's a birthday party, and plus we leave in the area and go there at least once per week. I was very very disappointed. I loved the place but now I don't feel like going there ever again and of course all my friends will know about this issue and such a negligent attitude to regular customers.

review_text: Our first brunch in Chicago and we chose Pinstripes. A place that has bowling and bocce ball in side. But they also had a stellar brunch until 3pm. It's a good thing that we arrived at 2!We were seated almost immediately and then shown around, there was just about everything you could choose from: Carved meats, hand made omelets, waffles, meat balls, chicken wings, pizza... Quite literally .. EVERYTHING. And the desserts were to die for. They even included Mimosas in the price.  I enjoyed the carved meat station the most, it was good prime rib! The salads and the home made breads were so tasty. I would love to come back.

review_text: This is my first one star review and it is not about the place but about the management team in Pinstripes in Streeterville.Last Saturday it was my best friend's birthday and we decided to watch fireworks from the restaurant's patio and have drinks and snacks with friends. On Tuesday I talked to the manager, Spencer, who told me that he could definitely help us out with this reservation outside. Next day my friend came back and made a reservation. She picked 2 high tops at the very end of the patio for 12 people on Saturday night at 9pm. The manager assured her that if we come on time there would be no problem with anything. She also asked if she needed to make any kind of payment to make sure to keep these tables, but nothing was required. On Saturday in the afternoon we got a call from pinstripes saying that the reservation will be pushed to 9:30pm. We said okay, because the fireworks did not start until 10:15. But. At 9 pm when we were already dressed up and all the guests were on the way we got another call saying that our reservation is cancelled and they can't accommodate us with the sitting outside. We were talking to some other manager whose name I unfortunately do not recall and he said that he can't give us anything outside because of two prepaid private events. He offered us to get a table inside which of course made completely no sense for us. In short, my complain is not about cancelling the reservation but the way it was cancelled ten minutes prior to our arrival! That's absolutely unacceptable! They didn't give us any time for a back up plan! I don't believe that the whole team was not aware of these prepaid private events at least couple DAYS before. Worse comes to worse they could have cancelled it with the first call in the afternoon but not the very last minute. I just don't understand how people can do it without thinking. They knew we asked for outside, they knew it's a birthday party, and plus we leave in the area and go there at least once per week. I was very very disappointed. I loved the place but now I don't feel like going there ever again and of course all my friends will know about this issue and such a negligent attitude to regular customers.

review_text: Our first brunch in Chicago and we chose Pinstripes. A place that has bowling and bocce ball in side. But they also had a stellar brunch until 3pm. It's a good thing that we arrived at 2!We were seated almost immediately and then shown around, there was just about everything you could choose from: Carved meats, hand made omelets, waffles, meat balls, chicken wings, pizza... Quite literally .. EVERYTHING. And the desserts were to die for. They even included Mimosas in the price.  I enjoyed the carved meat station the most, it was good prime rib! The salads and the home made breads were so tasty. I would love to come back.

review_text: First time at this location.  Usually go to northbrook location cuz closer to home.  But was in the city with family n went with kids for dinner and bowling.  The good...Bowling was pretty cool!  Had the blue lights goin on n kids loved it!And it was half price on bottles of wine!!!! The bad...Service was a bit slow.  We were all super thirsty from walking around all day and we needed lots of water but it was hard to get it.  Missing a couple place settings.  Also hard to get.  Food all came out at different times and so some finished before others.  But not too much of a big deal cuz we're staying to bowl anyway.  Was't in a hurry. The ugly...the foodI LOVE PASTA!!  Ordered a chicken Alfredo kinda penne pasta dish.  Don't recall exact name.  But No gusto!!  I love al dente "noodles"!!!  Love to twirl it on my fork and take a huge bite!   So I asked to substitute the penne for spaghetti noodles.  Big mistake.  When you switch up a dish I guess chefs panic n it just doesn't come out right.   Or at least that was the case here.   The pasta was way over cooked.  It was like eating a big bowl of thick creamy mushy noodle soup.  But the flavor of the sauce was ok. Just not a good pasta experience.  Hubby had ribs.  He liked it.Kids had spaghetti.  Didn't like it but sausage was good.Cousins had a Cajun seafood risotto dish (basically looked like jambalaya) that was a bit salty n a salad they liked.Prob will return for bowling n half price bottles of wine on Friday nights.  And I'll try not to substitute anything!!!

review_text: I really love the idea of having a great time while enjoying an activity you love as well. Pinstripes definitely give you this experience! Not to mention the food is awesome! The flatbread, the salads, pastas, and ribs are all really really good.  It's definitely not your typical bowling food - so much better and higher quality. They have more than enough bowling lanes for plenty of people to enjoy. I think this is a perfect place to take your family, go by yourself, or even on a date. It really has it all. The service is fantastic! Very attentive and super friendly. Everything is topnotch - clean and inviting! I believe they have a patio, which I would like to try next time I go.  The location I think is perfect - near the lake and close to other attractions. If you're looking to bowl and enjoy some cocktails and great food, go to Pinstripes. You'll have a great time!!

review_text: $8 Kids' meal is an awesome deal, dessert was awesomeWe didn't have a reservation but was still able to dine in the lounge area before our visit to the Navy Pier (read from fellow Yelpers food in the pier is horrible). I wasn't expecting too much from this place given the 3.5 rating but was genuinely surprised. We had:Prime Rib Sandwich served with fries - deliciouss! Juicy and tender, the brioche bun was perfect for soaking up the au jus in every dip. The au jus wasn't salty, but just had enough flavor to up the ante. Fries were shoestring and perfectly saltedPepperoni pizza personal pie - standard pizza with spicy pepperoni, my wife liked itChocolate Smores (dessert) - Damn, why don't I make this more often? Oh, yeah, it is a pain in the ass to make (easy to burn the marshmellow and a mess to clean up). While it is still messy to eat, I have no clean up and they made it just perfect with no burnt marshmellow tasteIntelligentsia coffee - My wife prefer this way more than Lavazza But here's what my daughter had for $8!Marinara bread stickOrange JuiceMac and Cheese2 Chocolate Chip cookiesIt was a steal. Granted, my daughter is not yet 3 so as my wife pointed out, this meal probably won't be enough for older kids. But add a side for them and they are good to go!

review_text: Okay,so I booked a party of 10-the day for bocce and dinner.  I had 2 choices, eat first and then play or have a wait staff for our area so we could eat and play.  I decide eat and play would give us the most flexibility for fun and mingling.Things I didn't know to ask:How long do we have the bocce court if we are doing an eat and play? I assumed it would be at least 2 hours--BUT NO--it was only one hour, half of which was spent deciding on what to eat!  So when does court time commence?If your food is not served till after your time is up...do you keep the lane? Nope! We were asked to leave the lanes, which totally broke the   Fun eat and play experience - worse yet the party that was expected was a no show!  Seriously? Why kick us off the court if the next party is not standing in front of you? How much does it cost to play bocce...like duh...but I didn't ask--it was $5-6 bucks per personUltimately, I would NOT recommend the play and eat option unless you are clear that you expect to have the court for the duration of your party!  Know how much per person it will cost for the court...and then enjoy the toss of the pallina!

review_text: Love the food and cocktails here. But the service is often a little "off".Chicken corn chowder (Mondays) and chopped salad are go-tosGreat flatbreads, particularly the prosciutto and fig (pizzas are also yummy)Baby back ribs were surprisingly awesomeApps like the spinach artichoke dip and hummus platter are great for happy hourSkip dessert, just not as on point as the rest of the menuAs for the service, there seems to be a lot of confusion over who owns what sections. We've sat in the bar section on the left of the entry and never been served. Every time we sit in the dining room, we've waited a very long time for our drink order to be taken and then are waited on by multiple people, which seems to reflect a sense of non-ownership of the table. (And I'm really not very picky about service.) It's certainly not enough to make us decide not to go back, but it's always a bit puzzling that they don't have this figured out.However, the food, atmosphere and daily specials keep us coming back weekly to this neighborhood haunt.

review_text: Okay so unlike most of the people I know who go on and on about Pinstripes, I am happy to say I can "see see that the emperor has no clothes".1) When we arrived and ask for a table, the young ladies ran off what we had to do so fast and so immaturely, we had to ask several times to repeat.2) My friend's lasagne was like MUSH and my Caesar Salad dressing had enough vinegar to fill   Lake Michigan.3) But the best, the best was our brain surgeon of a waiter! Mr. A I will call him. We saw him standing idly for a few minutes and asked for the check. He said sure! Then, get ready, he went and took an order from a 12 person table and kept us waiting. My friend and I stared with our mouths open as we watched both idiocy and inconvenience in action.It was nearly 25 minutes when he suddenly emerged with our check.Pinstripes - you are well suited to whoever you are well suited to!!!!!!

review_text: Like other reviewers, I came here with a friend for the Yelp Elite event. I was impressed. When I first walked in, I wasn't sure if I had the right place because it feels like you're walking into a restaurant. I tried to peer beyond the restaurant tables to see if I could spy the bowling alleys, but they are discreetly at the back in another room. You wouldn't have thought that they had bowling and bocce. The bocce is in the basement and the set up was pleasing. There was also a bar there and plenty of seating. The whole venue is classy, spacious, and pleasing to the eye. Great design.Bowling was a lot of fun. I loved that they had logo'd socks if you didn't have any. Their shoes were so shiny and new, as were their balls...tee hee. Tito's and Buffalo Trace were featured in their cocktails. I stuck with the bourbon ones and the cocktails were excellent.Food: I had the Italian beef flatbread or pizza...couldn't tell which, but it was good. Desserts were good as well.They get one star knocked off because service started a little slow and was feast or famine, and food was ok, but they're trying to work out their kinks as I'm seeing in the other reviews. Our waitress was sweet and nice, despite the fact that Yelpers allegedly (i heard from a bartender at another yelp elite event) not tip well, if at all, at these free events.  She was busting her butt.I'm a fan and would come here again.

review_text: I really loved Pinstripes! It felt like being in a wine region venue more than anything else - you'll know what I mean when you go. The place is spacious and roomy yet by the bar it's cramped.We had drinks and were lucky that they had $5 Bloody Marys and $3 mimosas. They also have a wonderful Chenin Blanc which I became addicted to. The service was professional and friendly.We didn't bowl or play bocce ball but plan to next time.If you have a special event, I suggest looking here because they have a large private room downstairs.The only reason why I didn't give Pinstripes five stars is because the music is atrociously bad - adult contemporary elevator music was their choice. IMHO opinion, if they want to have a more elegant atmosphere, I'd suggest they play jazz.

review_text: I attend a Yelp Elite event at Pinstripes and I will say they have a great space! Two MASSIVE floors.During my time at Pinstripes, I spent most of the time playing Bocce. They have three turf lanes/courts in the bottom section of their establishment. You can play with a few players - probably max of three per team so you can have a fair amount of turns. It's A LOT of fun. Some people get heated, so they include a tape measure. Trust me, it's necessary. I ordered a few drinks, and the service was a tad slow. I actually ended up chatting with the manager on staff, Kyle, and made the experience much better! He is incredible kind and attentive. For this reason, I'd deff go back and play some more bocce and grab drinks. They also have a bowling alley - did I mention it's a huge space - on the ground floor but I never left the bocce lane. This is a great place to go have drinks and hang out with friends. It's a relaxed environment with two awesome activities. Why would you stay at home and play beer pong when you could go to Pinstripes? Check yourself!

review_text: I LOVE PINSTRIPES.  There.  I said it.  I feel better.Bocce is probably the funnest thing out there.  My husband and I went together for a Yelp event, and we had the best time.  The snacks that were passed around were also delicious.  We loved it so much, we went back a few days later on a double date.We started off great--we ordered some appetizers and drinks and started playing.  Unfortunately, there was a mix up with our reservation and our game was stalled for a little, but the manager (Chris--love that guy!) quickly swooped in and basically made the night for us.  When I say the service at Pinstripes is unparalleled, I mean it.  He made sure we had the best night, and we definitely did.  The food was also incredibly delicious--everything we ate was amazing.  I'd highly recommend Pinstripes.  I can't say enough good things about it.  I think it would be a fab choice for a first date, a night out with friends, anything.  The restaurant/bowling alley/bocce is gorgeous and high end, but without the crazy prices.  GO NOW WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR.

review_text: I went to Pinstripes last night and it was fantastic! The ambiance of the place is like no other--I really like how they built in the different areas still keeping the art gallery look. That is really unique to the space. They have a giant level in the basement with bocce ball and a full dining room and bar. Upstairs you have bowling and another bar as well. There really is a lot of space for groups and I personally love that because I usually hang out in groups of people. The food: This place has so much good food. They have phenomenal bruschettas that I ate a ton of and they have great little mini burgers as well. They both had particularly distinct flavors that I have never tasted at other places that offer this type of appetizer. The drinks: They have great wine on deck--the merlot was my favorite and I had a couple of glasses of that. Their mint moscow mules were also fantasic--sometimes too much lime in it though but other than that the taste on these were also distinct. I'm a fan of anything moscow mule. The vibe: The vibe here is great. I'm all about good vibes and this place makes it happen. The staff here were all fantastic---it all started at the door when you first walk in you are greeted right away and they want to help you. The hostesses are not just standing around unaware of what's going on---they actually know what's going on and even give you suggestions. I dealt with Amanda and Cynthia and their customer service and stature were beyond outstanding! I have never gone to a bowling alley with such good service. They made sure my group of friends and I were comfortable at all times and even joked around with us. In short, they made sure that we were having not just a good time, but a memorable time. If I owned my own company they would be hired in a heart beat! I will definitely be back to Pinstripes and I'm 100% sure that I'll choose Pinstripes over Lucky Strikes that is down the block any time that I want a good night out. I also cannot wait to try their brunch!

review_text: I've been here on 3 separate occasions now and have so many good things to say about this place. Weekend brunch - AWESOME. They have a carving station, waffle station (my favorite), omelette station, chocolate fondue station, both breakfast and lunch options, and kid favorites (fries, chicken tenders, pizza, etc.). All so good. Oh! and (how could I possibly forget) bottomless mimosas!Private Bowling Party - AWESOME.They have a private bowling room that is great for birthday parties and groups. Their event coordinator is extremely accommodating and went above and beyond to ensure we had a great time. Dinner on the patio - AWESOME. They have heaters, blankets, pretty lake view, good food, reasonably priced.Catering for corporate events - AWESOME.I've also worked with Mallory, the catering sales manager, to coordinate a few corporate events. Always have a great experience working with them and without fail, they always do a stellar job!Overall, this place is just awesome. Just go here with some friends at any time for any occasion and you will have a good time. I promise.

review_text: Walking down the street when we were offered free lemonade by Raymond. He was one of the friendliest guys I've met and he told us all about Monday's specials: $10 all you can eat spaghetti & meatballs and chopped salad.Me and all my cousins got the private 2 lanes. The vibe is super nice with jazz music playing and great lighting. The spaghetti and meatballs are super amazing! The chopped salad is also very good too, almost on par with Portillos salad. They gave us free socks to take home and my parents got free glasses of wine with the wristbands Raymond gave us. This is a great place to take your family for a fun night. Amazing staff and great bowling.Thank you pinstripes and Raymond!

review_text: We went there to celebrate our 14th wedding Anniversary with our daughter. We were looking for a place where we all can have fun and this was the perfect place. We bowled first then went for dinner out to the patio. I think Pinstripes has one of best outdoor sitting spot in chitown next to the Chicago river with an awesome view! It was very romantic to watched the sunset and cuddle with the bonfire even fireworks from Navy Pier. Staff was very helpful and friendly specially our waiter Greg and Alex Michaud who at the end of our dinner brought us a complimentary dessert, it was delicious! Food portions are decent and reasonable prices. They have a wide selection of wines. I will definitely recommend it and continue to come to this place, also been at their oak brook location which I totally loved it. Thank you guys!

review_text: In a hurry and need some good ol American breakfast?  Look no further, palace grill will satisfy your needs.  They don't severe fancy schmancy breakfast so don't expected unique combination of foods and flavors. This is your typical diner with excellent food, the only difference?? Their coffee is amazing. They serve lavazza coffee and it is amazingly brewed. My favorite place to sit is at the counter because I love watching the cooks make each breakfast to order. I also love seeing my order being made and drooling over other plates I wished I ordered. For breakfast I got the corned beef and onion omelet with cheddar, it was a favorite and HUGE. Only ate about 1/2 of it and had to take the other half home.

review_text: It was a busy holiday weekend with waits for breakfast/brunch at places in The Loop ranging from 1-1.5 hours. No thank you! So we decided to get out out of the congestion a bit and came to Palace Grill (rode Divvy Bikes from Millennium Park and it was about 15 mins). So glad we came to Palace Grill! A total locals spot. No fuss, your basic diner menu. Eggs, skillets, simple French Toasts/pancakes/waffles. Service was top notch! Friendly and attentive. The owner walked around and said hello to every. single. table. Giving his regulars hugs, asking about their week, etc. Thanking every person for coming in. I had the banana bread French toast and it was very good. Moist banana bread, great flavor. My husband had the porky skillet (hash browns, ham, sausage, and bacon, topped with two over easy eggs). It also came with toast and we easily could have shared! He thought it was great!Cash only. If you are visiting Chicago and want something basic and off the busy street, visit Palace Grill and you won't be disappointed!

review_text: Ignore the hours yelp has posted, the Palace is open before every Blackhawks game including evening ones. This is our to go place before a game.  It's a grill so do NOT come here expecting canary tongues on toast.  Do come here and get their Denver omelet, their skirt steak sandwich or their mac and cheese plate with jalapenos.  Everything is great here.  Hell, you can even eat kind of healthy here but really, why would you?  We love coming here to eat as much as we love seeing our beloved Blackhawks play.

review_text: This place is like a neighborhood diner/ family restaurant you get a very warm feeling from the ambiance. I heard about this place from a friend decided to check it out. It was pretty much a full house when we came in there was a huge group taking up about eight tables. The restaurant employees were very accommodating to groups. There are tons of sports gear on display as historic artifacts. This place gives you a setting of all things Chicago. Now for what we all come to Yelp for... You can never really go wrong with getting a skillet at breakfast spots so I got the country skillet eggs over medium with pancakes. The coffee was good and strong. I had a very good experience here no complaints besides the tables being so close together. My boy friend got an omelette he was left very underwhelmed. I would come back to this place and I also would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for some decent breakfast in the loop.

review_text: We are spoiled in the west loop with so many unique eating spots -- it is welcome and refreshing to have a place that focuses on a hearty, basic menu. And does it so well! A good old fashioned "diner" type menu with friendly service in an atmosphere that can be called a museum of Blackhawks photos, autographed jerseys and fun Hawks themed tables and chairs. Impeccably clean and brightly lit, with a cute outdoor seating area. My Reuben and onion rings were delicious, my husband had one of the breakfast farmer skillets, also delicious. The variety of food on the menu is impressive -- including the desserts, a whole slew of milkshakes and breakfast all day! Servers, busboys and everyone else we encountered were warm and friendly -- I cannot imagine anyone who comes here not becoming a repeat customer.

review_text: I visited Chicago this past weekend and had the opportunity to dine here. It's a very popular all day breakfast place dedicated to the Chicago Blackhawks and established in 1938. I loved the atmosphere and the service was amazing, very friendly and efficient. You definitely feel welcomed here and the place is buzzing with conversation. It is a pretty small place packed with tables to try and accommodate diners. As any good breakfast place should be, it was packed on a Sunday morning.I went with the Denver omelette, "best omelette you'll ever eat" with grits and toast. I had to get the grits because I had never been anywhere that offered them before. The hash browns definitely seemed to be the more popular option. The omelette was essentially a western omelette and I went with the sausage as my protein, with American cheese on top. It was very big and filling, and delicious. I would have preferred it if the egg hadn't been wrapped around the filling so that all the contents wouldn't just fall right out when you cut into it.Overall, they offer a great menu with lots of hearty options and a great place to have breakfast with family and friends while getting a real Chicago experience.

review_text: This place is adorable. Came in for a late and hungover brunch with a group of five and were seated immediately, even though the place is quite small, It's decorated to look like an old boxcar diner which we thought was cute. We split blueberry pancakes as an "appetizer" which were yummy, but nothing breathtaking.For my meal, I had the veggie omelette with feta cheese which was HUGE. I finished it all. It was disgusting (the amount of food I ate, not the food itself). The hash browns were really yummy and a good mix between crispy and soft. A friend had the special chocolate chip an strawberry waffle and it was INCREDIBLE. Crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside. It honestly tasted like a cupcake. So delicious. Our waitress was sassy and joked with us, which we loved. Only downside was the price. I pad $20 for an omelette, a cup of coffee, and a few bites of shared pancakes. I realize $20 for breakfast in the city is almost nothing, but almost everything was pretty basic, so it seemed a little steep. The up-charge for my feta was around $3.

review_text: My Melanie and I  went in for an omelette after an audition down the street. I have had some - shall we say - not very good experiences in the past with this place - but my Melanie loves the Blackhawks so I knew she would get a kick out of this place.The walls are covered with jersey and pictures - they even have some Patrick Kane autographed "stuff" for sale.We started with coffee - she commented on how good the coffee was - which prompted me to order coffee. We each got an omelette - hers was cheese and onions - mine was cheese and avocado. We both got hash browns - well done. i got sour dough toast - she got wheat toast.The food took a little longer than expected - there weren't a lot of people - but when it came was quite good. The toast was room temperature and the butter was too hard to spread - but everything else was quite good. I really enjoyed mine and Melanie ate more than she usually does. They had Frank's Hot Sauce and Cholula. Having both is enough to get me back there. I can't understand why any restaurant today wouldn't have either of these and they had both! Melanie also pointed out how good the hash browns were. They were the real deal - just like my father used to make. The service was personal and charming. The owner (George?) was actively working the room to make sure that everyone was having a nice meal. I will surely go back there. Service this good forgives cold toast.(That should be someone's slogan!)

review_text: We were headed to the first Blackhawks home playoffs game of 2015 on a Sunday afternoon but needed to grab food first.  After consulting Yelp, we decided to check out Palace Grill.  For the same price as some crappy arena food, this was definitely the place to go.  We had a little wait but that was to be expected.  While we waited the owner came around offering coffee to anyone, and when one lady half jokingly asked if she could have a bloody mary instead, he obliged!  My only complaint was people were waiting in line out the door so we hopped in line.  It wasn't till 2 groups had walked past us that the people in front of us decided to tell us they weren't in line for the hostess they were just waiting.  Well then why not wait outside/not in a queue?!  But that's their fault, not the restaurant. It's definitely a small place, smaller than the pictures led me to believe.  I had a breakfast burger which was perfect before a game.  Great food, great service, I wish I lived closer I'd be back more often.  Definitely will recommend it to anyone going to the UC.

review_text: Made my second trip to Palace Grill yesterday (a Sunday morning around 11 AM); here's my update:1) Service is only so-so, but ownership/atmosphere are incredible.  Especially if the owner comes by and chats you up (or any of the regulars, which there are dozens) or if you make the mistake of showing up in a Packers jersey for a Bears/Packers Sunday!  Definitely a very Chicago-ish place to take friends from out-of-town or if you are a sports fan.2) Prices, for the serving size, are a little high (of course, this fits the neighborhood).  In fact, that's the main difference between Palace Grill (on Madison) and White Palace Grill (on Canal)--at WPG, you can crush the place for $30 and feed 3-4 people.  At PG, $30 probably only feeds two adults, three tops, for a very negligible difference in quality.3) Skip the milkshake.  Now that I've had it twice, you can do so much better elsewhere!4) Skip the pancakes.  I feel like Saturday/Sunday mornings at diners are when the kitchen will really shine, and my pancakes yesterday were pretty plain (had a short stack).  I like a good diner flapjack and this one was relatively forgettable.5) My vote for what you should order when you go to Palace Grill?  Anything with the hash--this is a must--then a skillet or the Denver omelette.  I tried the chorizo/peppers skillet (decent size for $11) and I would get that again; my Denver omelette during the first visit was only okay and management sent me a note after writing my first review daring me to come back just for that, so I know that item is a source of pride on the menu.  My dining partner wasn't raving about her basics (eggs, French toast, etc.) and I felt the same way so skip the normal eggs/pancakes/French toast if you come here.Only had to wait about 20 minutes yesterday morning so they turn tables over pretty fast even when it is crowded.

review_text: Sometimes plans have to change last minute and when you have a dog in tow, there's no turning back and taking her home, at least not if she's my dog.  That's what happened this past weekend.  As we're pulling up, yelp comes through and informs me they have a patio and there on their fence was a big sign saying "patio open!" and no sooner do I say "but do they allow dogs?"..there in the corner "a dog friendly place", or something like that.Look, not only do they allow dogs, they're really great about you having a dog.  There are a few water bowls on the sidewalk, the first thing they ask you is "would you like a cup of water for the pup?" (and yes, I heard them ask this to others who sat down after us) and then they tell you how adorable your dog is.  Which, if you've ever seen my dog you know is the truth.Moving on.  The patio is small, yet I'd say there were at least 10 tables with adequate room between them.  The food is typical diner food, yet it alllll looked good.  My desire for a skillet went out the window when I saw the word "gyro" in an omelet.  Surely they have a gyro plate then, right?  Indeed they do, and I saw at least 4 other people order one.  They don't skimp on ingredients.  If salami is in your omelet, you're not going to have to dig to find it.  Everyone was pleased with their food, the waitresses couldn't have been any friendlier and it was nice seeing at least 3 other dogs come and go while we were there.  Oh, and there's all the Blackhawks stuff.  I guess that's cool.  I mean,  enjoyed this place so much that I'm willing to look past that part.

review_text: We got there on a Sunday at 11am for brunch. We walked in to find a host and ask for outside seating. The host had a smart attitude and showed us how to walk outside as if we were idiots. We told him we just wanted to be nice and check with him before grabbing our own seats. The waitress was rude and brought the check while we were still eating without asking if we wanted anything else. There was another waiter who kept harassing us by picking up our plate without asking if we were done and it wasn't even near closing time. Later on he came again to pick the check that was already on the table and said: "Here is the check in case you didn't see it" and laid it on the table.The food was OK but I don't think I'll go there again. There are way better brunch options in the area.

review_text: We stumbled upon this place while trying to find a spot to eat and drink before a Blackhawks game (since West End was packed) and it was the best thing that could have happened to our day. The family/community atmosphere in this place is contagious and everyone working there was SO welcoming. The owner made his rounds and chatted with each table in the restaurant, thanking them for their patronage, engaging in friendly/genuine conversation and telling some really funny jokes. The decor in the restaurant was an added bonus as well - so much Blackhawks memorabilia that are cool conversation pieces. The food was also phenomenal - we got the Sunshine burger and its up there with some of the best burger places I've been to in the city. The Bloody Mary was amazing and my friend had the screwdriver - which was probably the best I've ever tasted since it was made with fresh OJ. This is my new go-to spot before a Hawks game. I cannot wait to come back again!!!

review_text: We were in a hurry so we popped into here to grab something quick to go. The food is cheap and prepared quickly. I ordered the ham & cheese sandwich with fries. The sandwich was tasty and filling. You get a lot of cheese and it is served on quality bread. The fries were also pretty good.I love this type of place. Old school diner type places almost always have quality homestyle food options. The one downside to this place is they are cash only. That is the sole reason it got only three stars.

review_text: I used to come here 20 years ago when it was just a tiny shack.    My mom worked about a block north of here and I would walk here for lunch/dinner when I was visiting her office.It's amazing what they've done with the place since then.   It's bright and airy now.   Blackhawks memorabilia on the walls and a classic diner checkerboard floor.The menu is classic American diner: omelettes, eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, etc.Hash browns are probably the best in town.   Made fresh (not frozen) and cooked crispy and seasoned well.

review_text: Came here for a breakfast date and had a pretty good time.Service was a little weird, our waitress could have been a little more attentive and seemed a little bit lost. She might have been new.Besides that the food was quite good. My date had the skillet which was pretty delicious with hash browns and eggs and bacon and peppers, but it came with american cheese slices and not a real cheese.I got the ruben sandwich and it was probably the best I have ever had. The bread was crispy and all the ingredients mixed together very well. Fries were not bad but nothing amazing.I would say their prices are a little on the higher side but they do give you a good amount of food. Also they are CASH ONLY so be prepared.

review_text: I came in to grab a quick order to go. I was probably in and out in 10 mins- Sweet!I ordered the banana nut french toast. The chef who prepared it was so boss. I just sat at the counter in awe of his chef skills! He cooked the French toast perfectly (5 stars for him), then handed the plate to the girl behind the counter.... that's where we had trouble! Don't get me wrong, she seemed really friendly, but she had allergies and was coughing all over the place. She went to go slice my bananas and did so with her hands! I so grossed out she touched my food since  she was coughing and cleaning right before it. I ended up tossing the bananas and some of the French toast slices as soon as I got outside. Luckily 2 slices were untouched so I ate those and they were delicious! Other things: They Only Accept cash. And they have a parking lot.

review_text: My friends and I came here for a late breakfast one evening - the staff were super friendly and it was very cute inside with the checkered floors and lots of memorabilia hanging on the walls.  We tried out the Palace Grill's Special French Onion Soup, the Stuffed French Toast with Nutella & Bananas, 2 Eggs with Bacon (that came with hash browns, toast, butter, and jelly) and a Bacon Omelette (also came with hash browns, toast, butter, and jelly).  The French Soup was okay, with the croutons and the melted cheese on top - the soup itself was fine with the sauteed onions.  The stuffed french toast was nice and soft, and came with thick Texas-toast-type of bread with sliced bananas on top.  The omelette was done well was of generous size (definitely enough for another meal the next day); the eggs/bacon/hash browns were very simple and traditional.  I would like to come back to try out their famous sandwiches.  Cute place in the West Loop area.+late night diner

review_text: I took my middle son here before a Hawks game. I ordered a spinach and feta cheese omelette, he a turkey burger. I devoured my omelette. It wasn't anything different, but prepared well. The turkey burger was a bit sweet for my son's tastes, I ended up finishing it.So why five stars when the food merits something less? Because George, the owner, is a rock star. He walks around greeting everyone--and it is sincere. You can see he really loves connecting with his customers. On top of that, we inadvertently put George in an uncomfortable situation (completely my fault, not his). He handled it with the grace and generosity of a very kind person. I will come back here because I'd rather eat pretty good food served by an awesome owner than great food served by a faceless, nameless corporation.

review_text: The diner is cute and the service here was above and beyond.  Everyone from the buss boys to the manager were helpful and always asking if there was something they could do to help.  I came with my family, and we were a group of 6.  They don't have many large tables, so it took a little bit of time to accommodate our group.  They offered us all coffee and drinks while we waited.  I heard how great the hash browns were.  I'm a hash brown groupie, and these were good, but nothing amazing.  I think people are impressed because they shred the potatoes to a finer consistency, which makes them a little bit like hash browns with mashed potatoes in them.  They were a great consistency, but needed more seasoning or onions or something to be amazing hash browns.Overall, the meal was good, but nothing amazing.  The sausage pattie, while large, were dry.  The eggs were made to order, which is great.  I usually order hard scramble and am disappointed when my eggs are still soft and runny.  The pancakes were just ok, nothing special.  Overall.  it was a good experience, but I think there are other diner options that are better for breakfast.

review_text: The Palace Grill is one of our favorite places in Chicago.  My son and I started going there for breakfast on our "guys days" when mom was working.  Our go to feast is the National Anthem Waffles (yes, it has ice cream!), with a side of scrambled eggs and bacon...for the protein, and hash browns. Lucy, Christina, and George (and everyone else who works there) are always friendly, and are genuinely happy to see me and my son.  They always make us feel like old friends.  Lately, my wife comes with us, which is a major guys day violation!  But she likes the place as much as we do, so we feel bad leaving her out because she is a pretty cool mom.  It is nice that the girls at The Palace give mom a bit of a hard time for joining us on guys day (it reminds mom how special she is to be included in such an exclusive group).The food is great and the people are even better.  Five stars is not enough for this place.Go Hawks!

review_text: I have been here a couple of times over the years, but honestly took it for granted as a diner. Now that we have kids, we came back this time because of kids-eat-free Monday. The experience made me wonder why I don't come here more often. For starters, it's a classic and classy Chicago establishment. Lots of cool Chicago pictures, most of them sports related. It's the kind of place you proudly bring visitors to, but not the played out touristy type of place (ie, Gino's East). And being down the street from the United Center, it's been a great Hawks diner - even before they were awesome, but obviously more so now. Second, this place is super family friendly. Not just by the kids eat free thing (which us a plus!), but the whole staff is as friendly as the owner.  For as popular as this place has become, and as trendy as the West Loop now is, they've not let it get to their heads. You still feel like you're at a genuine family diner...because you are!Third, the prices are great, and not super bloated to mine the new money of the West Loop.  Cash only at this place didn't annoy me. Finally, breakfast all day! My 4 year old daughter had chocolate chip pancakes for dinner--two HUGE ones. She ate all of it.  Couldn't put her to bed that night, but it was worth it. Great place to eat and make friends.
