review_text: The Palace Grill is a landmark diner located in the West Loop community area that has been in business at the same location since 1938.  It is open seven days a week and offers a wide assortment of typical diner fare.  There are two separate dining areas, one with tables and the other with just a counter and stools.  The dcor is a throwback to the forties and fifties.  The walls are covered with white and black tiles and adorned with Blackhawk memorabilia and photos of celebrity patrons.  The tables have black tops edged with stainless steel and the chairs have chrome supports with red seats.I have been a customer for many years, and based on my standards for evaluating diner food, I have always been very pleased.  The staff is friendly, courteous, and attentive, but what distinguishes this diner from all others is the owner George Lemperis.The Lemperis family took over the operation in the mid 1950s and George Lemperis has worked in the restaurant for over 35 years.  Mr. Lemperis is an animated high-energy personality who is an extremely friendly and likable man.  He has developed a huge following because he treats his customers like close friends with sincere affection.  Although Mr. Lemperis works long hours in the restaurant every day, he always makes time to greet new customers and chat with his steady patrons, asking about their wellbeing and telling a joke or two.  Regular men customers can always expect a bear hug from Mr. Lemperis and the ladies a kiss.  Mr. Lemperis clearly gets a great kick out of mingling with his patrons and ensures that a visit to the Palace Grill is always a fun time.

review_text: What more needs to be said about the West Loop's oldest and friendliest restaurant? Classic diner food served under the watchful eye of the establishment's mayor and mascot, George. George lead the whole restaurant in singing happy birthday to one of his friends and constantly circulated making sure every patron was happy. We had a great breakfast - a skirt steak skillet, a salami and mushroom omelette, and a banana and nutella-stuffed french toast, and all three delivered. I asked for half the cheese on the skillet, the they nailed it even giving me an extra egg. Nice.It's exactly what you wish you had on the corner of your block, wherever you live, for a not-quite-healthy, but good-for-the-soul breakfast on Sunday morning. We'll be back.

review_text: Just because it is a Blackhawks institution and had a bunch of memorabilia on the wall, it doesn't mean that it is good. I went there before the Blackhawks Stanley Cup parade and celebration at about 7:30 AM. I just had traditional two eggs, over medium, bacon and toast. Well, the eggs were eggs and nothing special. The bacon was thick, but extremely tough. It was more like beef jerky than bacon. As far as toast, how can anyone mess that up? The actual toast was fine, but the butter they served with it wasn't spread butter and I could only put one lump chunk on my toast. Then with that, I had to fold the toast in order to get any butter on the rest of it. The toast was also cold, so there was no melting of the butter the spread it. Overall, it wasn't great.As far as the service, I wasn't impressed. I wanted a table, but because I was the only one, they made me sit at the counter (which is something that I absolutely hate). The only seat at the counter was right next to the cash register, so it was extremely noisy. Yes, I understand that they might have been busy because of the parade, but if I don't want to sit at the counter, I don't want to sit at the counter, plain and simple! Not like I was asking for an 8-top table all for myself. I just wanted a regular table.The only reason I get it two stars is because I am a huge Blackhawks fan and have been since I was a child. Still, I don't let the Blackhawks' lore blind it as far as opinion of it being a "restaurant". I wasn't impressed. I plan to come here during a slower time for lunch or dinner to see if there is a difference. Hopefully I can write a much revised review.

I tried a piece and thought it was a 4...just a bit tough for my liking.My wife got the fried pork chunks. I thought they were dry. She liked them. Finally, the dessert of flan was delicious.So there you have it, a decent meal and drinks, decent service, and 4 stars. Everyone was pretty satisfied.

review_text: It is with regret that I have to write this review. As much as I have loved my prior experiences at Seor Pan, unfortunately my visit this afternoon was not pleasurable. My sister, who is in town from California wanted to treat me to a graduation brunch, so without further hesitation I recommended this establishment. First, we walked into the restaurant and there was no hostess to greet or seat us; so we took it upon ourselves to find a table. At that point, a waitress looked in our direction and hesitated to service us, and attended to another customer. After she attended to the other customer, she came over and took our order. After suggesting Monday's lunch special, my sister and I ordered the same meal; Lechon guisado, arroz congri, and yuca.  After getting our meals, my sister and I were conversing when she found a hair (black) in her Lechon guisado. Immediately after I called the waitress over and explained the situation. She was kind enough to offer another plate of food, but at that point my sister was quite disgusted, and lost her appetite. I was SO embarrassed that I had recommended what I thought was a superior food establishment, especially since she was visiting from out of town. Seor Pan did not charge her for the meal, but proceeded to charge $13.15! How disappointing! Seor Pan could have picked up the tab, especially for this type of discrepancy. Finding a hair in food is a health code violation! Sincerely,Disappointed customer

review_text: A most perfect lunch joint for takeout, couples, or small groups. Family friendly.The ropa vieja sandwich is the only true way to go.  It's saucey and savory.  It is hard to chew, and will get in your teeth, but I tell you, my friends... SO worth it! the bread they serve the sandwich on soaks up the sauce in a complimenting way.... *salivating in nostalgia*I have tried the pulled pork/lechon sandwich which is also good, but fares on the drier side.Don't count on the chips that come with the sandwiches. I think they're okay, but papery, and sometimes lack in flavor.  Needs like a cajun seasoning, or something with a kick. Instead, order a side of sweet plantains! can't go wrong.Ive tried the champagne soda - DELISH!also had the flan, which was also really good, drizzed in caramel. Very thick, creamy, and condensed in flavor. If only I lived closer... this would definitely become a guilty pleasure. It is definitely worth a drive to. On the plus side... they're open pretty early! since they offer bakeryish items, I believe they're open at 8am. they also offered a pretty nice groupon deal and yelp offer, last i checked.

review_text: This was the place me and my boyfriend picked for our first dinner date a year ago because it's Cuban -- and he only eats Cuban food. Till this day, this restaurant lives up to my boyfriend's expectations. He's lived in Cuba all his life up until three years ago -- he knows what it's supposed to taste like. & I can quite agree with him that it is delicious.I always enjoy having Rope Vieja in sandwich form, and itself with congri, and yuca en mojo as sides. (& that yuca has the perfect taste) My boyfriend loves the pork-chops, and the steak -- they're juicy, and easy to eat. Their chicken dishes are also quite amazing. -- Also their cafe con leche is toooooo die for -- so sweet refreshing. The service is always optimal! Everyone is extremely well informed of the menu. The wait time for food isn't long. They throw really nice birthday celebrations with their hats on, and birthday music. Overall, I'd recommend this place to anyone wanting to try authentic Cuban food.P.S. The Yelp deal on here makes this place 10X more affordable for bigger tables.

review_text: The service was very poor. When my family and I got in, there was no one to greet so we sat down at a table. We started looking over the menu to see what we would order. No one brought us water or asked us if we wanted an appetizer. So I started looking around at the waitresses standing around to see if anyone would notice that we were ready to order. As I was about to get up and go ask for assistance, a waitress finally came over. We ordered our appetizer and food all at the same time. The appetizer did come before the food which was a plus, then came our food. The food was good. There just needs to be consistent with the service. The waitresses need to be more attentive and alert. Be courteous as well. I remember when I came here last time the waitress we had was very nice, but today the waitress that we had was not pleasant. Great service will keep people coming back! There just needs to be a sense of urgency in this place. I think I'll just take my food to go from now on, or just order from somewhere else with similar food.

review_text: Loved this place! It's a little far from my home, but totally worth it. The staff here was tremendously friendly and gave myself and my family a nice warm welcome. We all ordered the Bistec Encebollado and chose the sweet plantains for the side. We decided to go with the rice with the black beans mixed in and that was also good.The yelp deal is totally worth it. I bought the $20.00 for $40.00 worth of food. If you check in on Yelp you also get a free Cortadito. For dessert we had the flan. I'm usually not a fan of flan, but this was really good. It tasted like it was dipped in some type of caramel sauce.Other positives about the restaurant is the parking. There's a parking lot, but also tons of free street parking. I would totally make the trip back to try other items. I asked the waitress for other suggestions and she said the Pork meal was also great.

review_text: Senor Pan has some great deals on Yelp - a free small cortadito when you check in, and a $40 for $20 deal. That was totally worth purchasing for a group of 3.The parking is scarce, that part wasn't fun. Once we got in, we felt right at home. It is open and clean, with lots of Cuban decor. It's casual, but not a hole-in-the-wall. They have plenty to choose from on their menu. I decided to go with the vieja ropa, and it did not disappoint. It was everything I had hoped it would be. The tostones were great too. Overall the food is cheap - the portions are just enough to fill you up. We were worried about not being able to spend $40, but we made it happen! The mojito was great too.The service was not great. Our servers switched...and we never really knew who was serving us. They did not come very often (for having 3 servers we should have seen at least one) - we had to flag them down a few times. We were never really asked if we wanted another drink. We waited forever for the check. We had to ask for water twice. We said we didn't want sugar in our coffee, but it still came with sugar. And we didn't get a good-bye. Food, awesome and cheap. Service...meh.

review_text: Great food and attentive friendly service during our visit to this family restaurant. Running a successful restaurant in Chicago, no small feat in this city of so many wonderful places to eat! Appears they just opened another location in the Humboldt Park neighborhood.Packed out on a Sunday morning with happy families. Appetizers and entrees were authentic and tasty. My meal roadmap; start with side orders of yuca frita, yuca con mojo (cassava with a great garlic sauce), mariquitas (plantain chips . . again with the awesome garlic sauce) before moving on to my favorite entree, Masitas de Puerco Fritas (fried pork). Amazingly good! Finish up with a cuban coffee (cortadito). The only drawback of senor pan, inadequate parking for their popularity. No biggie, street parking is available if you act fast.

review_text: I've been coming to this Senor Pan for years, feel that they are getting too lazy and stingy with their food.They brought us Warm water and stale sweet potato chips.  Ordered the soup and sandwich combo, the soup bowl was so small only 1 piece of meat and a piece of potato was able to fit in the bowl. Had asked they give me a bigger bowl or a full size sandwich. The waitress acted as if I was trying to get a free meal.  She went to speak to the owner who isn't very nice at all. He doesn't bother talking to you, or even smiling.  No matter how many times he may see you at the Restaurant, and sees how much money you spend and how many new people you may bring. But I think I'm going to start trying different Cuban Restaurants in the City and give Senor Pan a rest.  I work hard for my money so I deserve good and friendly service. review_text: After a party night in Chicago, next day me and my boy got up hungry!!!! and yelping for breakfast places I found seor pan. We got an AWESOME deal on yelp,  for $20.00 we could spend $40.00 which I found it a lot of money for breakfast. At the beginning I wasn't sure to go or not because it was out of my area but and the end we decided to go. When I walked to the restaurant I found it so nice just when I walked in. Place look very clean was packed and smell like yummy Cuban food. Me and my boy ordered right away Cuban cortadito (coffee) and a trio of empanadas and and must say WOW. Coffee was just on point it was so delicious probably best coffee so far in Chicago. Empanadas had enough meat inside and were tasty. Then we ordered our main dishes I ordered pork roast  with Cuban rice (rice with black beans) and fry yuca. My boy ordered deep fry pork cube Cuban rice and plantain. I can't not express myself how AMAZING was this food it was so good everything and they serves so much we both have to take it to go. This Cuban place is def in my top 10 best restaurants I have been in the city is very hard for me to give 5 Stars but seor pan deserve it. Place, waitress, atmosphere, coffee, appetizers, food everything was excellent.

I wound up ordering two steak tacos, 1 shrimp taco, and rice and beans. Now, I chose to eat in the car because I wanted to continue to listen to THE SERIAL in my car. This made me even more excited to eat my meal. I first dipped into a steak taco and was expecting magic. I got a slightly better than average steak taco. They weren't stingy on the ingredients but it just wasn't a great taco. The shrimp taco was sloppy and disgusting. Do not order this. A family member under the age of 3 can make a better shrimp taco. The rice and beans were the highlight. I probably would have enjoyed my meal with just that. But that's pretty tragic. I would give this place another try though. The people working were working very hard (another hand could help) and they were very nice.

review_text: They are back and stronger than ever. The old Takoz from Taylor street has been reborn in a new location and a new taste of flavor. I believe you are really going to love the prices at the new location as well as the flavorful morsels of Mexican fare. The spices in food that we all missed for almost a year has returned to take it spot amongst the ever rivaling Mexican cuisine that has landed on Taylor street in the last few years. With the closing of Joe's and other spots, it is a very good landing in its new renovated spot. I think this time the restaurant has given itself a new life and a new outlook on what it considers to be REALLY GREAT MEXICAN FOOD,just how an abuela (grandma) would do in her own kitchen in off road site some-were in Mexico. Thank you for coming back and giving us probably the best Nachos with cheese and meat Taylor Street has witnessed. Burritos of charbroiled skirt steak rival the best ones on 26th street or in Pilsen. This time, the resurrection of a staple on Taylor is staying, and we are SO happy it has become the Phoenix in Little Italy.

review_text: Nice little place. Very simple & straightforward menu, the two tacos I got were excellent & def had some flavor in them I could not put my finger on. I got the al pastor & the chicken. They come with 2 salsas, green & red. The red is tangy and nice but the green is mg favorite it had a nice hint of lime that is often overpowered in other green salsas. I always walked by this place & today I thought, what better way to compliment a salad than with 2 tacos? There was some minor confusion, after I placed my order & was waiting a second employee came out & asked what I ordered & if I paid yet. Bear in mind I was the only patron at the time. Not a big deal but it makes me question their processes.They have a good number of Mexican sodas including coca cola Mexican edition with real sugar. They also have a lot of pre packaged tamarind & horchata drinks. I need to eat here a few more times before I can be totally sold but so far so good.

review_text: I was sad when Takoz on Taylor Street closed but then they re-opened a few doors down.  I go there a lot because it's inexpensive, the meat is tender and flavorful, everything is fresh, the owner is very friendly and takes pride in quality, and it's less than a block away from me.  The char grilled steak is phenomenol!  It's my favorite place in the city for steak tacos.  The homemade quesadillas are sooooo good with guacamole, lettuce, tomato inside.  The chorizo is delicious, the flavor of the chicken is fantastic but the chicken is a little dry.  Everything else on the menu is delicious and it's cheap.

review_text: Went there for a dinner before a movie. Wife and I shared Calamari Fries, Beet Salad, and the Salmon main course. The server was extremely nice, and the service was great. The chef and server both apologized to us that our food was late in coming out, though neither my wife nor I noticed any sort of delay. The Calamari Fries were great! Breaded and fried like the Calamari you're used to, but with a cut of squid that is much thicker than usual. The beet salad was also very good, and constructed in a really interesting way. It had very few greens, and a generous portion of beets and cheese. The salmon dish was also tasty. Cooked properly, although a little less fun than the Calamari Fries and the beet salad.

review_text: yelp check in for a free order of the #16 biscuits ($6 value) which remind me of the pilsbury grand flaky biscuits. i probs wouldn't pay full price for them but they're good and even better when they're free! i believe they're also only $1 during happy hour. i tried two different stouts (~$7 each) and my friends tried a variety of cocktails (~$12) that they all seemed to enjoy. we had made a reservation for 5 people and they sat us in a semi-private room with a circular table and its own tv. nice decor and ambience for a night on the town. they also have awesome service - it was one of my friend's birthdays and they brought both a round of pineapple/cherry shots and desserts for us! the executive chef stopped by our table to say hello. i believe this place is relatively new and i must say they're doing a great job of making a name for themselves. would recommend!!

review_text: The GoodThis place just opened not too long ago.  Located in the Courtyard Chicago it is chic, intimate and oh-so-good.The BetterService was great.  Our server made great recommendations and was also able to accommodate the #16 Biscuits without the bacon bits (you can also call ahead of time to see if they have a batter available).  And were they worth every carb and calorie.  Served with a side of honey butter they biscuits are great.The BestWe ordered the Classic Burger, Fish tacos and Mac and CheeseThe burger was perfect.  Ordered medium+ and it was juicy, flavorful and a hefty patty for the $12 price.  Served with steak fries which were also great.Fish tacos were good, not great.  They lacked a citrus/creamy component which made them a little dry.Baked Gouda Mac and cheese was creamy, gooey and the portion was great for sharing.  Really great flavor and not overpowered by the gouda. Overall, with the combination of the ambiance, menu and taste of the food it was a place I would like to come back to and try other items on their menu.

review_text: Service was attentive and helpful, flavors rich and uniquely combined, and the atmosphere classy but not pretentious. We walked in on a Saturday evening and sat ourselves at the dimly lit bar. Their selection of local beer is wide but not overwhelming, and the bartender was able to give us recommendations based on our taste, and she nailed it. I'd come back here again.The Fox Burger was perfect, an adjective I don't use for burgers often. The meat was cooked at the requested medium rare, the topping were balanced properly with the delicious, juicy meat, and the bun was expertly made/selected, able to stand up to a hearty burger without being too dense or becoming soggy. The beet salad was also very fresh and tasty, although just a tad small and could have used just a few more walnuts, otherwise properly executed in both the taste and visual departments. We also noticed the wide variety of people here, which made it interesting to sit and stay a while. There was the smokey, raspy voiced and ostentatiously "fabulous" woman, the older man who repeatedly humble bragged to the bartender that he was a regular for years, and the lone, respectable looking guy just quietly enjoying a few beers, a burger, and dessert on his own.

review_text: I've been meaning to visit Copper Fox Gastropub for awhile and tonight o finally got the chance. Our server Chloe had an awesome personality and made us feel very welcomed.The food at Copper Fox is pretty darn good and we there with stomachs that we're happy and stuffed. We had*Biscuits - were light and fluffy. The honey butter that came with them was so good. And we got them for free when we checked in on Yelp...score! (4 stars)*Calamari Fries - were delicious. I liked how they came out looking sorta like mozzarella sticks. I did not like the tarter sauce that came with it. I think marinara sauce would go better. (4 stars)*Crispy Chicken Sandwich - was beyond good. It was truly crispy..in a great way. And the chicken was juicy. I'd definitely get this again. (4 stars)*Fish Tacos - were fantastic said my dining companion. He said they were the best he's ever had. (5 stars)While the food and service were 4 star worthy, the wait time for our appetizers and entrees was not. That's why I have to deduct half a star and give Copper Fox 3.5 stars.

review_text: Came in because of the stellar reviews and left disappointed. Got a free order of the biscuits with Yelp checkin. These were ok, not as flaky and delicate as I've had at other places, and don't taste anything special.I got the classic burger, ordered medium but it came out medium rare. Having a short lunch hour meant I didn't have time to send it back for them to get it right so I ate around the rare bits. It wasn't very juicy, the messy juices were primarily from the sauces, the burger itself was strangely dry, despite being undercooked. Only saving grace were the fries, which were fresh out of the fryer.Friend ordered the crab cake which looked like a decent size and came with a nice side frise salad. I didn't try it but it looked like it had good proportion of crab meat to filler, which was good. Friend enjoyed it and thought it was a generous portion.Being from Northwestern, I showed my ID for 20% off. We put down 2 credit cards, thinking we'd just split the bill since the prices were similar. Server got all upset and insisted we tell him which entree to charge to each card. Not sure what the big deal is, but certain do not appreciate being yelled at by server. It's math, not rocket science! Chill out!

review_text: I love this place! I came here for the first time when this place was new and only had 2 reviews. Since I'm a big review person, my friends and I were like hmmm, should we risk it? and I'm so glad we did. We were greeted by a nice guy who took us to our seat and gave us some insight on the menu. I ended up ordering an avocado turkey sandwich which was wonderful, but you know a turkey sandwich is a turkey sandwich. My friend's ordered a beet sandwich and something with lobster in it, which they thoroughly enjoyed. My favourite part of the meal was DEFINITELY those absolutely delicious biscuits and while writing this review, my mouth is watering cause they were probably the best biscuits I've ever had. (Note: I haven't had many biscuits). Also the sweet potato tater tots that came as a side of my friend's beet sandwich? MMMMMMmmmm so good. (I think they changed their menu, but BRING THESE BACK) After lunch we were so so stuffed, but my friend has a sweet tooth and decided to go for dessert. We ordered the brownie with hazelnut icecream and after we devoured that, the chef sent us not one, but TWO desserts on the house. A strawberry shortcake and something else I forgot. But anyways, although we were bursting at the seams, we almost finished every single plate. Would definitely go again. Only didn't give 5 stars because I like to reserve my 5 stars for absolutely mindblowing experiences. TL;DR Ambience 4/5, Food 4/5, Service 5/5 Go here if you have the chance.

review_text: This space that occupies one section of the ground floor of a hotel doesn't look much like a  gastropub, but the food definitely qualifies.The standout item was the #16 Biscuits, probably the best biscuits I've ever had. They were crunchy on the outside, warm and flaky on the inside, with a slight herbal scent. The honey butter was a perfect accompaniment.Smoked gouda mac and cheese was also very good, with slightly crisped edges due to the bubbling hot skillet it was served in.The seven layer chicken salad was a nice combination of romaine, corn, black beans, shredded chicken and ranch dressing. Less interesting was the hamburger, which was fairly ordinary, and served with thick cut, skin on, somewhat limp fires.Service was friendly. There is an adjoining bar making some interesting cocktails, including several complex variants of the Moscow Mule.

review_text: We really enjoyed our meal at the Copper Fox! We made a reservation (Friday night), but were able to get a last minute one easily. Although I'm guessing it will get more difficult as word spreads about their great food and service. Decor was awesome - loved the metal mesh curtain and the large modern light fixture. Started with the #16 biscuits. They were warm and perfectly crisp and flaky on the outside, soft and warm on the inside. Really great! They were served with a whipped honey butter, which I didn't love (maybe it needed a little salt). I ordered the crispy chicken sandwich and it was amazing! The chicken was really crispy and large, but pounded thin, making it easy to eat the sandwich without it falling apart. I loved the spicy kick from the jalapeo vinaigrette (but it was thicker, like a mayo, actually) and the creamy avocado. Plus there was a sprinkle of cojita cheese which gave a good saltiness. The pickles!! They are thick cut and pickled in house and so, so good. A little spicy and full of great flavor. The executive chef visited our table and was very gracious and friendly.  A great spot for dinner!

review_text: To be honest, I was going to give this place 5 stars for its super hip ambiance, attentive service and mouth-wateringly DEEEEELICIOUS #16 biscuits with whipped honey butter (which is also free with Yelp check-in by the way!), but the rest of the food just doesn't earn this place its 5th star. I ordered the Fox burger for my main course. It sounds really good with crispy onions and a house made special sauce. However, its taste isn't worth the $14+ I paid for. The avocado fries I ordered along with the burger were interesting but maybe avocado is one of those things that just shouldn't be fried. I know I'm hating on the food, but will def come back for the biscuits and drinks!

review_text: Sat at the bar and wanted to order the entire menu. The bartender talked some sense into me and directed me towards the Calamari fries, sample of Avocado fries and the Crispy Chicken sandwich. The calamari fries were not the best calamari I have had but the first I have had in a fry form and they were very solid (gotta give them a break Chicago is in fact in the middle of the country - fun fact for everyone who's first day on earth was today). The crispy chicken sandwich was a generous portion and had a nice jalapeno spread and delicious pickled onions (think fast food chicken sandwich but 10x better). The avocado fries were a bit of a let down but not because of execution, I just didn't love the flavor of them.All in all, Copper Fox is a great spot for drinks or food and I would highly recommend.

review_text: First...this is NOT a gastropub. This is a very typical hotel restaurant inside the Marriott Courtyard.Second, the dinner menu choices are so slim that I thought there were pages missing. There are only six items on the dinner menu. So if you're considering this place, you better check out the menu first, you may not find anything you like on it.Third, the place was empty Tuesday night, so I hardly needed the reservations that I made.Fourth, food was just OK, as was the service. We waited so long for our cocktails that I thought the waiter forgot us; and it certainly wasn't because he was busy serving others.Finally, the Hostess was superb. She was very friendly, efficient, and pleasant.

review_text: No slackers workin' in this kitchen!  Loved the meal.  The easy like Sunday morning cocktail was also good.  #6 gin is a bit much for a martini.  I asked for 1/2 cap vermouth in it and i totally couldnt taste it.Fox burger is good.  If you ask for rare it comes that way, and the hand cut fries that accompany it were nicely spiced.  They could have been a bit crispier if they were 1/4" slices instead of 3/8", but thats not a huge deal.Pan roasted salmon just a bit too salty, according to the elder son but he ate it allPork porterhouse was great.  The sauce made it, and i loved the crispy brussel sprouts on the side.The avocado turkey sandwich met with my younger sons approvaal.  I loved the housemade rosemary potato chips.  They were quite subtly flavored, but i liked the fact that the waiter checked with him when taking the order, making sure that he was ok with the rosemary.Worth coming back for sure.  Not sure when  i'm in Chicago again, but it was good enough to go again.

review_text: We found Copper Fox on a last minute witch hunt for lunch somewhere nearby the Contemporary Museum, and we're so glad we ended up here!Our bartender (we were seated at their gorgeous bar) told us upon seating that they were running a $5 mimosa special on Saturdays and after that, we really didn't need to hear anymore (totally joking). Honestly, can you really go wrong with $5 mimosas? The answer is no, in case you needed some help on answering that.To pair with the mimosas, we had the Fox burger (which was cooked perfectly) and the lobster roll (which was extremely fresh).If we ever find ourselves back in Chicago, Copper Fox is definitely a place we'll be coming to again.

review_text: A nice addition to the food options available around Northwestern hospital! I've been here a few times now and have to first compliment the service - always impeccable. Everyone from the hostess, to the waiters, and even the chefs - who came to ask how our meal was on a few occasions - were incredibly nice. It's a great place to sit and catch up with friends vs. the other  similar dining options nearby options: Greenriver is pricey, Beatrix is always busy and requires reservations, and the Windsor is strangely dark inside. As for the most important part: the food, it's pretty good so far! Anything between buns has been delicious and perfectly cooked, such as the Fox Burger and the Crispy Chicken. They're also reasonably priced. The biscuits are a bit of a letdown; everyone I've eaten here with always brings up the comparison with Popeye's biscuits, which win the battle every time (probably due to the copious amounts of butter and salt they use). But If you checkin here on Yelp you get free biscuits! You don't get that at Popeyes. The biggest disappointment on the menu thus far has been the pan roasted salmon. It was overcooked and didn't have much flavor to it. I didn't want to take the leftovers home with me, which says a lot because I'm all about leftovers! The drinks can be pricey, and in some cases they're more expensive than your entree. But the crafted cocktails are delicious and are whipped up fast. Also important to mention: Northwestern employees get 20% off! Found that out by accident during my most recent visit there when my badge was randomly laying on the table top. Overall, I'd recommend this place if you're around Northwestern's downtown campus.

review_text: This place opened up just minutes from my apt., and after an endorsement from my visiting cousin, decided to stop in. Have since tried the famous #16 biscuits, a few different entrees, and avocado fries as a side. Biscuits: These are phenomenal. Perfectly crisp on the outside but with flaky layers for days. Served with a generous serving of honey butter that you'll probably want to spread on everything. If only I knew how to make these myself; but I'll settle for ordering these every time I come by. Avocado fries: These are actually pretty delicious, and if I knew how they got the breading attached to the slices of avocado maybe I'd be a little less impressed. In any case great texture, and a fried food that you don't feel bad about eating for once. This comes in a salad as well and I would have no qualms ordering it. At 6 pieces for $5, serving size for the avocado fries could be larger.Diver Scallops and Pork Chop have always been solid entrees. The only thing I disliked was the Roast chicken, which turned out to be much drier than it was promised to be and altogether not very enjoyable(aside from the grits which accompanied it). Entre portions aren't necessarily massive, but with a side of biscuits(and avocado fries) you'll most likely be at a comfortable level of fullness with your meal. Entrees run you $20-28 or but if you still want great food for a bit cheaper they have a bunch of salads, burgers, and sandwiches that are will run around $10-15 range. Service is impeccable in any case

review_text: So, after some heavy shopping my boyfriend and I got hungry and decided to stop here. Upon entry, the decor seemed fancy but yet the ambiance was inviting and casual. We were seated right away in what I would consider one of the best tables in the restaurant without reservations. We decided to sit next to each other in the bench seat where they have a charger outlet attached to the side of the arm. What great foresight and thinking to do this! So many times I wished there was an outlet for me to charge my phone at with the convenience of it being at my table. Our waitress, Celeste was very sweet and made sure we were enjoying our food and kept the refills coming. The prices are comparable for the area. We checked in on Yelp and got the biscuits, which was totally worth me curbing my no-carb diet for. I was only going to have one bite, but ended up eating half of it making myself stop. I got the pork porterhouse and my boyfriend got the prime strip, and both were absolutely fantastic. It was quite and indulgent lunch. What made the experience memorable was Chef Courtney coming out and talking with us. I think he went by every table. When he came out the first time we talked biscuits and my boyfriend mentioned how he loves KFC's and now this is his favorite. I asked about the brussell sprouts and he told me that they deep fried them. I typically pan fry or roast them and so this makes sense as to how the ones here are so crispy and addicting. Surprisingly Chef Courtney came back to bring me the spicy ones with jalapenos and vinegar and they were amazing. I love the combination of the tangy and spicy. I now am cooking mine like this, but not deep fried for the sake of saving some calories. After I slathered most of my slices of pork in the chipotle sauce that came on the plate I moved on to my boyfriend's bbq sauce that came with his steak because I love really good sauces. My boyfriend and I wanted to come back for dinner. It was so refreshing to be able to talk with the person that cares about connecting with the people enjoying their meal prepared by the staff there. It wasn't a pretentious conversation either it was very genuine and comfortable. He told us that the servers actually get tested on the menu so they have to know their stuff. I will have to quiz them the next time I'm there. Ha! I have been telling people at work about this place, and have plans to take my family here next time they are in town. I always like to try new places so it's tough to get me to come back, so this is certainly an exceptional place in my book. I think the hotel is lucky to have such a wonderful restaurant. This is a great example of Chicago hospitality. My only fear is that it will start getting so busy that I will not be able to come here on a whim!

review_text: After being at a near by movie theater, my friend had mentioned this restaurant just recently opened up and so we thought we'd check it out.  Granted, this restaurant is at the base of the Courtyard by Marriott, so you may miss the entrance or think it's just another hotel's restaurant with bland food and poor service, let me tell you it is not.We were greeted by the hostess and were seated right away.  Our server, Christopher (I believe - Sorry that I didn't remember his name) had greeted us, went over the menu and took our cocktail order.  The menu is limited, however, I felt they had enough items to choose from.  Upon the servers, return, we were ready to order.  My friend had a wrap and I had the Salmon entree.  I had asked the tomato sauce to be placed on the side.Our food was brought to us within 15 minutes or so (due to the fish).  The entrees were excellent.  The server would check in with us.  Of course, we had to try a dessert.  We had the Strawberry Shortcake.  OMG, it was a great way to end a great meal.  The biscuits were salty and with the strawberries it was just excellent.  The next day, we were still talking about those biscuits.  I would highly recommend this restaurant for the food and service!!  Looking forward to my next meal.

review_text: While recently visiting in Chicago, my boyfriend and I decided to venture in to the Copper Fox.  The restaurant itself is gorgeous.  We loved the metal mesh curtain on the wall and the light fixtures as well as the open space.  The restaurant had a fantastic wine selection and great cocktails.  We tried the #16 biscuits, that the restaurant is famous for, as an appetizer and they were pretty good.  They were a little too salty for my taste and being from the South, I feel as though I have a good handle on biscuits.  My boyfriend ordered a steak and he enjoyed it.  I ordered the salmon and it was really good except I would have preferred less tomato sauce.  I felt like the tomato sauce drowned out a lot of the natural flavors of the salmon.The service we had was next to none.  Our waitress was knowledgeable and fun and she made our experience memorable.  She had such a great disposition and her service was efficient while also expedient.  Overall, we really enjoyed the Copper Fox and would recommend it to anyone looking for a nice meal at a beautiful venue.

review_text: It was raining and my feet were killing me from all the shopping, so I ducked into the nearest decent-looking eatery and that's how I happened upon the Copper Fox. I had no expectations, but was pleasantly surprised to find this total gem of a bar/restaurant.First of all, the service at the bar was exceptional--a great combination of friendliness and attentiveness. The bartenders went out of their way for me, seeking out tea (they have a good selection, btw; I'm a tea snob) for me, and making a chocolate dessert that wasn't on the menu appear after my dinner. Even the staff members who weren't waiting on me were friendly. :)Speaking of dinner, it was delicious and reasonably priced for the quality and generous portions. I wanted some comfort food, so I had the mac and cheese topped with breadcrumbs and crispy brussel sprouts, both served in small cast-iron skillets. The mac and cheese was quite good, but the brussel sprouts were spectacular, a fantastic mix of sweet (carmelized) and a tiny bit spicy (pickled jalepenos), cooked to perfection. The chef was right on the money, and very nice to boot (he came out and said hello).When I spoke to the manager (also very nice) I was surprised to find out the restaurant had only been open for THREE DAYS since their remodel. Beautiful build out, atmosphere. I stayed much longer than intended because I thoroughly enjoyed myself. Thanks, Copper Fox!

review_text: My first visit to this restaurant proved that sometimes the staff at a restaurant can transform a so so dining experience into a better one. I was scrolling through Open Table looking for a last minute dinner reservation and then this place peeked my interest. My boyfriend and I came in for a 8:30pm reservation and were seated after about 5 minutes. The interior of the restaurant is very stylish and fresh. We started with drinks, and I ordered one of their whiskey cocktails. My cocktail was well balanced and perfect for a summer evening. To eat I ordered the fried avocado and mac n cheese. My boyfriend ordered their crab/shrimp roll. We were having a good time catching up, but eventually around almost 9:30 we kind of started getting concerned because our food hadn't come out yet. Our waitress was nice enough to check on our food and give us an update. After our food came out, both the manager, waitress, and head chef came out to ask us how our food was and apologize for the long wait.  All of our food was delicious. The avocado fries were to die for and better than the ones from that Cheesecake chain down Michigan ave. At the end of the meal we received vouchers to come back and get free drinks, and our sweet waitress also took off the cocktails we did order from our bill. The food and excellent customer service is a big reason as to why I would come back if I were in the area. If you are staying in the connecting hotel, or just wanting some good quality American food, then Cooper Fox is a great option.

review_text: I am compelled to write my first Yelp review after a wonderful experience at the Copper Fox.  We Yelped for a place to eat and found that the Copper Fox was new and highly reviewed.  We gave it a try mostly because we hoped not to have a lengthy wait (Friday night, downtown Chicago).  We were incredibly glad we did.The restaurant has been beautifully remodeled for a casual elegance.  Really enjoyable aesthetic.Our service for six people was incredibly attentive, pleasant and informative.With the 6 of us, we had quite a variety of dishes.  All except for the scallops (a tad overdone) were quite exceptional, with really memorable flavors and combinations.  It's honestly difficult to identify particular stand-outs, but I always appreciate recommendations in reviews, so here are a few (though I would honestly highly recommend everything we had, except aforementioned scallops)-pork porterhouse-OMG.  Perfectly seasoned, tender and massive-fried avocado salad is unique and delicious-biscuits- of course-peach shortcake with true pistachio ice cream-great little local craft beer selectionThis experience kicked off the first night of a family Chicago vacation.  We could not have had a better experience.  Highly recommend!

review_text: I took a chance on this place because the reviews were good. I typically don't prefer eating at hotel restaurants unless it's room service because in my experience hotel restaurants have average food. I was proven correct again. The biscuits were really tasty, but the entrees we had were just okay. I went with a chicken dish based on wait staff recommendation and my friend had a burger. The chicken was dry and bland. My friend's burger was overcooked. The fries were good. They discounted our meal after we only ate part of it and gave us drinks on the house. The service was good, but because of the food I probably won't go back.

review_text: Really good food. Such a massive upgrade from Viand. We had the biscuits (great, a tad too salty on the crust maybe), calamari fries (also great), fried avocado salad (amazing dressing - not sure how they made it), and pan seared chicken (comes with charred corn grits, ridiculously good). Every dish has some interesting little twists and innovations. Great to have a decent place in this area. Definitely coming back. ThxD

review_text: We were staying at a nearby hotel and my 16-month-old son and I were exploring the magnificent mile while my husband was at a conference. Finding places that are very kid friendly can be challenging. We ordered the biscuits with the free yelp check-in ; they were crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside ; the honey butter was a light sweet flavor; definitely good especially since they were free, worth getting. I ordered the crab cake,  the waitress accidentally gave me the crab and shrimp sandwich,  she very quickly corrected her mistake and one of the other staff came to check to make sure everything was OK we were satisfied with our order. Crab cake was very good, almost all crab no filler, the salad that came with it had a flavorful light dressing on it. The portion was small but for downtown Chicago the price wasn't bad. Glass of Riesling I had was very good.While we were eating one of the chefs  behind the kitchen counter was playing peekaboo jumping up-and-down behind the counter for my son making him laugh. Definitely made our day, I would return here.

The manager did his best but really barring the miracle burger had no answers for us. The food. Dumb us, from Maryland and ordering a crab cake appetizer in Chicago. Burgers not cooked to temp. Cocktails- lousy margarita with maybe a bug in it. No explanation, just took it away. Atmosphere- it's cheesy sales man chic hotel dining. review_text: First time to Chicago today for one night and chose to have dinner here to celebrate finishing grad school. From the moment we walked in, the staff was incredible. Our waitress was so nice. We had a few mixed drinks, the biscuits and calamari fries for starters. Crispy chicken sandwich, salmon, and pork porterhouse for the main course, and the brownie, apple pie, passion fruit for dessert. Evvvverything was delicious. On top of that, the chef came out to make sure we were happy with our choices. I could tell he loves what he does everyday. I would give them six stars if I could. Go there for dinner tonight.

review_text: Delicious food and drinks.   Great local beer menu and wine menu.  The Chef came out twice, once to introduce himself and one to check on our meals.  We had the biscuits, to start, they were fluffy, moist, and buttery.  For entrees we had the pork porterhouse, diver scallops, and root vegetable risotto.  The pork was cooked perfectly and the crispy Brussels sports made Brussels sprouts cool again.  Scallops with fennel salad were a perfect pair.  The risotto was cooked to perfection and flavorful.  For desert we had the strawberry shortcake, which is made over their homemade biscuits.  Highly recommend.

review_text: The portions- huge. The prices- amazing. The service- phenomenal. The taste- fantastic. My boyfriend and I first visited a few weeks ago. We first ordered to stay and then remembered about 7 minutes later that we had a commitment elsewhere. He was very accommodating and the food came very fast! I got a red pepper panini and my boyfriend got an eggplant panini along with a pizza, all were top notch. He even sent us home with some complimentary Baklava. This man was so great to us- I hope the best for his business because he deserves every drop of success he can get! We will definitely be frequenting this place- fantastic food for amazing prices.

review_text: Cozy place for quality pizza. The actual restaurant itself is reminiscent of New York style pizzerias in that most people carry out and there isn't much seating. The staff was very friendly and welcoming, even before they learned we would be dining in. My friend and I shared the Mediterranean Pi- it was delicious, and it was the perfect portion for the two of us.As it turns out, Pi-Hi Cafe is across the street from my friend's partner's high school. She mentioned that her partner used to go all the time for lunch during high school, and immediately the owner/manager remembered him. I think that truly speaks to how much they care about their customers.

review_text: Hands down some of the tastiest, most unique pizza in Chicago!  The service is also some of the friendliest I have ever experienced!  We got the beef shawerma pizza and sausage pizza (they have many halal items on the menu).  The pizzas were freshly made and ready in no time.  The sauce and the toppings really took it to another level- I've never had shawerma on a pizza!  They also have milkshakes, smoothies, sandwiches, etc.  I'm going to order falafel next time (which the host graciously allowed us to sample- crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside)!

review_text: HALAL PEPPERONI. HALAL SAUSAGE. Right. Now that we have that out of the way- if you want some halal pepperoni (beef, obvs) pizza and you don't want to trek out to Devon (ugh), try Pi-Hi. Honestly, I have driven past here a million times but never realized it was food... doh. I think I saw the sign which has flame design on it, and the word "Hi" and assumed it was a vape cafe or something? Whoops.The pepperoni is delish (sujuk, for those of you who know what that is) and the sausage they use is crumbled kefte kabab and it is delicious. Like I kept picking pieces off, eating it, and exclaiming "Mmmmmmm!!!" (I should have probably ordered it to go, for obvious reasons...)Next time I'd ask for extra toppings (I just wanted MORE MORE MORE), and, I'd probably order a second pizza, but that's just me. My husband and I polished off one pizza in no time flat, but we also like to eat, so two normal people can probably get by with one :)Super nice staff. Menu looked tasty. And according to (I think he was) the owner, everything but the turkey is halal for those of you who care.See you soon, Pi-Hi!

review_text: My friend says I give way too many five stars (what can I say -- I have good taste and know where to go...) However, when I brought him to try the Mediterranean Pizza and the Spicy Chicken Shwarma plate, he was amazed. He would give this place a five star too. I think I saw his eyes roll to the back of his head because the food is so good. The Mediterranean Pizza probably ranks as one of the best five pizzas I've ever had in my life. The wood fire makes all the difference. The dough is delicious, the meat is fresh and succulent, the sauce is slightly sweet, and the basil adds another level of freshness. I also enjoyed the chicken plate but not as much as the pizza because it was THAT good. I also enjoyed the falafal as well. The owner is also super humble, very wise, and very passionate about his business. He gave us dolmas and baklava and the baklava BLEW me away. There's something so different about his baklava compared to the usually very, very sweet baklava that I usually have eaten.Anyways, come and support this business! It's a fairly new one but definitely worth the trek from wherever you are. ORDER THE MEDITERRANEAN!

review_text: If I could give 6 stars for service, I would. Food: 5 stars.The Mediterranian pizza will blow your mind. A wood-oven from Napoli heats to 800 degrees and creates a heavenly soft yet crunchy dough base. Topped with in house tomato sauce, shwarma, basil, and other fresh spices, it was probably the third best pizza I've had in my life. It was such a flavorful, masterful combination of tender, juicy shwarma and sweet sauce and fresh, tongue-livening spices that I was surprised the restaurant had only been around a year.4: The chicken chipotle shwarma was by no means a slouch, it was delicious and had extremely fresh salad. But it was overshadowed by the perfect pizza. 6 stars for the service. Fares was an absolutely gracious and warm host, and we felt as if we were dining in his home. We talked about life, our experience in the Middle East, our love for food, amongst others. He threw in free dolmas which were so fresh and grape-leafy, and went well with the tzatziki yogurt sauce. He also gave us free baclavas which were just as good if not better than that found in the Middle East. I was blown away.Go go go go go there now.

review_text: You can drive right by without noticing Pi-Hi, which is in a small strip on Western Ave.  Very unassuming front with signage denoting a fiery flame, but this camoflauges the name, especially at night. We wanted to check out the only Chicago restaurant that made the Yelp top 100 in the US!  Ultimately, good food on a budget, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.  The owner couldn't be friendlier, which I believe encourages the glowing reviews.  The meat in the beef shawarma is fine cut so every bite is flavorful.  The plate is an excellent value and comes with rice, salad, falafel, hummus and pita bread.  I loved the beef shawarma and falafel, but the hummus and pita were lacking something.  The hummus tasted plain and the pita wasn't the freshest.A good wood-oven pizza has an incredible crunchy crust but their version was doughy.  The margharita pizza was covered with basil, and the herb overwhelmed the flavors.  The sauce was also on the sweet side.  I would return for the schwarma but not the pizza.

review_text: It's really convenient for me to stop by Pi-Hi to grab food and since I love Mediterranean, I'm happy that it's so close by. The chicken shwarmma is fairly good so I tend to get a plate of that or sometimes the combo chicken which also comes with kebobs. The hummus is delicious and since most Mediterranean places don't include hummus in their meals, it's a really good bonus! On the other hand, the rice is rather plain though - it's missing some spices that could take it to another level. Also, the garlic sauce that I opted for on the side did not taste like garlic at all! Falafels - does not compare to Pita Inn...I am a strict believer that Pita Inn has the best falafels in the world so I was dying to try the falafels here given that some reviews have noted that the two are similar. Nope! Sorry, but Pita Inn still trumps all. It's not bad here but it's just not comparable. Sweet potato fries - Hm...what to say. Definitely not the best sweet potato fries I've had. It could be a bit crispier and less burnt on the edges though with more flavoring that actually sticks to the fries. Dolma - fairly cheap. You get 6 small ones for $2. I wish there was more stuffing to fill out the grape leaves.Pi-Hi didn't live up to its amazing reviews for me in terms of their Mediterranean food but I do plan on trying their pizzas and paninis later.

review_text: Alright, this review is way overdue as I've probably put someone's kid through college with all the food I order from this place.  Truth is I can't say enough good things about this establishment.First of all, the food.  If you want, super fresh, delicious Mediterranean food, you've found your spot.  I love the Chicken Combo plate here.  The chicken is succulent with a bit of char, the salad is tangy and delicious, the hummus is fresh and light.  And if that's not enough to get you in the door, TRY THE DAMN PIZZA!  Seriously, in a city of amazing pizzas, Pi-Hi makes theirs unique enough to stand out on its own.  It's light and fresh, cooked in a wood oven and the flavor profile is unlike most of your standard pizzas out here.  The pita and spice give it a middle eastern flair that have me ordering from this place again and again.And if that wasn't enough, the owner is one of the nicest guys around town.  Customer service is fantastic here.  These are the kind of people who get to know you by name and always appreciate your business.  These guys take pride in their establishment and it shows from the high quality of the food they make to the phenomenal customer experience they provide.It's always a pleasure ordering from here.  Keep up the good work guys!

review_text: Brought a group of eight for dinner this week; solid across the board.  Even though Pi-Hi is a Mediterranean cafe, you walk in thinking this is a pizza place, but everything is pretty tasty.  I tried the sausage and pepperoni pizza, which was good and actually had enough meat on it to keep me happy...the fries, hummus and pita offerings were also good enough.  The real winner here is the falafel, which is bordering on my new favorite in Chicago (although I have had good falafel at places like Falafel & Grill in Wicker or Taza in the Loop)...very fresh, tasty, not dried out at all, a winner.  Prices here are very fair--I ordered some falafel and two individual pizzas and came out of this for less than $25.  Me gusta!Service is great and the owner/manager (not sure which) on the night we were there was very accommodating.  Also--BYO policy here is a little fuzzy, but for now assume that it's BYO if you show up close to 7:30 or 8 during the week and it's not crowded.  It sounds like you don't want to show up with your own booze here any time when one of the HS students could show up from across the street to grab a pie.

review_text: What a hidden gem! I don't think I would've noticed this place if I had just passed by. Thank goodness for Yelp! We went in close to closing time on a Tuesday night. So, I went w/ a panini. I had a chicken, spinach, provolone, roasted pepper panini. Once I got my order, I noticed that they forgot the cheese. I went back up and the owner and cook were SO apologetic! They must have apologized 10 times! That showed me they care about their customers. My husband had an eggplant sandwich and he enjoyed it. We shared a hummus which was yummy as well. I was watching other customers come in and all were greeted in a friendly manner. I will definitely come back to check out the rest of the menu! Love hidden gems like this!

review_text: Give yourself a high five ladies!  You're number 100!!!  An undiscovered gem per the yelp data wizards (with help from darwin the dog).http://officialblog.yelp.com/2015/01/yelps-top-100-places-to-eat-in-the-us-for-2015.htmlhttps://www.google.com/search?q=yelp+darwin+dog+photos&es_sm=93&biw=1600&bih=799&tbm=isch&imgil=ZfvF-9lTcewJvM%253A%253BWyKGI5JGFUVbAM%253Bhttp%25253A%25252F%25252Fflickrhivemind.net%25252FTags%25252Fdarwin%25252Cyelp%25252FInteresting&source=iu&pf=m&fir=ZfvF-9lTcewJvM%253A%252CWyKGI5JGFUVbAM%252C_&usg=__lX5Gucq-kivWyUrZrUU9ipK2aIw%3D&ved=0CDUQyjc&ei=5MnSVIu-NYnrUrPcg6gE#imgdii=_&imgrc=ZfvF-9lTcewJvM%253A%3BWyKGI5JGFUVbAM%3Bhttp%253A%252F%252Ffarm1.static.flickr.com%252F71%252F177248148_05eb37436e_m.jpg%3Bhttp%253A%252F%252Fflickrhivemind.net%252FTags%252Fdarwin%252Cyelp%252FInteresting%3B500%3B375Which is why I rode my bike out to this dump, proudly nestled in an ugly strip mall on Western and Addison next to a failing Hair Cuttery outlet.  Now I'll admit I was skeptical about 'top 100' status going in.  So there was a bad attitude from the start.  But in my defense, looking at their yelp pictures etc, it looked like just another of a  zillion low end/casual dining Mediterranean places that all have the exact same menu.  I couldn't understand how this place could possibly be one of the top 100 restaurants in the country.I ordered the chicken schwarma plate.  As a bonus, apparently, you get free nonstop ass kissing while you're ordering.  Pandering to the nth degree.   The dude would have literally kissed my ass if I asked him to, I think.  Made me a bit uncomfortable.  Like when a dog is humping your leg.  You're all..."Haha...I guess he likes me..Ugh".  I grabbed a seat at the counter next to the window.  I had my elbows up like a little kid at the grown ups table.  Waaay too high.  Looking around the dining area, I could see the handywork of maybe one of the owners who can sort of build some things..but not exactly.  Overall it's passable but there are some screw ups.   Dude brought over my plate.   Had a falafel as part of it.  Excellent.  Really, very good.  And I've been to a zillion falafel places.  Hot, crispy on the outside, good flavor.  A+.  The schwarma was decent.  I think all medi places get their schwarma from the same supplier...on these huge rotisseries.  So hard to do much about that.At one point, while I was scarfing down the food, the head ass kisser was like "hey I've got an announcement everybody, we've only been around for a year and  we're number 100 on yelp (bashful look).  unbelievable and thank u etc".   Yes this happened.  Which I think is an honest response.  Overwhelmed and unable to comprehend random luck gifted by nerds at yelp and one dog.If this place wasn't a 'top 100' winner, I'd probably given it 5 stars.  That award is ridiculous.   So, I deducted one star for being ridiculous.   But hey, they're really nice.  Too nice now that they won the yelp lotto, but they'll get their bearings back in time.   And their food is excellent for a crappy medi place.   I've been to alot of these joints and I definitely agree they do a superior job.  Like 10-20% better than average.

review_text: Yep, so this place is one of only two IL businesses on Yelp's Top 100 in USA, 2015.  The previous reviews pretty much sum up the place - great food quality, no frills, small space, great value, and a genuinely friendly owner.  I agree on it all and it is indeed a nice Chicago neighborhood stop (across the street from Lane Tech) for very good and economically priced Mediterranean.  The food is all fresh, made to order, and piping hot when delivered.  They use a wood burning oven here.  The wife and I tried a chicken combo plate ($8.95) and a baklava dessert.  Ferris, the indeed friendly Palestinian owner, also treated us to a sampling of their dolmas, or rice stuffed grape leaves, and they made for a nice tart starter.  He prides himself on home-made freshness, and it shows.  He's been at it here for 14 months at this point.  Will try to make it back when in the area and in the mood for Medi.

review_text: I think I've found my new favorite lunch spot! So I work in the area, and I'm always going to Mariano's and chipotle. Well one day I was craving middle eastern and when I yelped the area I came across this place with its AMAZING reviews. How did I not know this place existed?? Went there and ordered a chicken shawarma pita sandwich. Checked out their menu while I was waiting and saw that it's not just middle eastern but also wood fire oven pizzas! They all sound yummy too. I started talking to the owner (I think it was, just seemed like he would be) and I was telling him how I wish my work would cater from here instead of some of the very unhealthy food they usually do. Then my sandwich was ready but he had me a wait a couple mins longer and he ended up giving me two big sides of their homemade hummus and pita chips to bring back to my work for everyone. What a great, cheap place for a quick bite. review_text: Ok, Let's start out by setting your expectations....Yelp's data wizards named this restaurant one of "Yelp's Top 100 Places to Eat in the U.S. for 2015". Which is an amazing honor, to say the least. Yelp drives businesses to succeed or fail, all based on a crowd-sourced reviews. These crowds are not restaurant critics or professional reviewers; they are (mostly) people like you and me trying to get the word out for our fellow man. This can certainly skew the score...But this is where expectations can be dangerous; especially when you might imagine what the 100 best restaurants in America could be. Visions of Michelin Stars start dancing in our heads, and avant garde places like Alinea, Grace, and The French Laundry are expected. This.Is.Not.That.This is instead an outstanding little Mediterranean restaurant serving up fast heaps of schwarma and falafal bedded in fresh hummus and baba-ganoush. They knock out solid wood-oven pizzas, great panninis, and really amazing smoothies. They pride themselves on making everything to order. No baskets of cooked falafel balls getting cold over the fryer waiting for you to order, nor spits of meat baking for days on end making a dry chewy schwarma. This also isn't a fancy Mediterranean restaurant to take the family for approachable ethnic food when they visit you from endless corn fields of Ohio; but instead a place to order delivery from, or to stop in as a small group for a casual lunch. What truly sets this place above the rest though isn't just the quality of their food; but instead the friendliness of the staff and owner. This is a true mom-and-pop joint, succeeding or failing by every customer who comes through the door. They could not be kinder or more generous; often even including little extras in your order when they recognize your face.Which brings us back to their place on Yelp's top 100 list....Is it what you might expect from one of the "Top 100 Restaurants in America"? Probably not. But say hello to the owner, have a little conversation with him, and I guarantee you will walk out understanding why Pi-Hi get's reviewed the way it does, and truly deserves it's place on that list. Also, if you are a return customer, do your neighborhood restaurants (not just Pi-Hi) a favor and skip using grub-hub or a delivery portal. These services are amazing, and I would often be left starving if not for GrubHub, but they often charge 10-20% of the bill for the service to the restaurant, which can easily overwhelm a family run restaurant. Pick up the phone, call the restaurant to order for pickup or delivery, and feel good in supporting your neighbors instead of some silicon valley dot-com company.

review_text: Pizza is incredible. It's light enough not to be "too much" and make you feel like a bloated meat sack, but it's still utterly filled with flavor and satisfies the appetite.The staff is warm enough that you start to think Chicago has some of the nicest people on earth.The place is clean and has a working bathroom.Prices are incredible. A 10" specialty pizza for $8?!?There are all sorts of other menu items I didn't try (Paninis, Smoothies, Fresh Juice, etc...) so can't comment on. But if they're anything like the pizza I would order them up in a second.This place really does deserve a 5-star rating with its 70+ reviews.

review_text: If you love Pita Inn, but live near Roscoe Village in Chicago and don't feel like hiking up to Glenview or Skokie to satisfy your Mediterranean cravings... well Pi-Hi Cafe is the place for you!Everything is delicious, from the chicken shwarma to the 3-cheese panini! The rest of the staff are super friendly as well. LOVE THIS PLACE!!!

review_text: This is a little cafe in the strip by Chase bank across from Lane Tech High School. Tiny but full of charm and quaint. Only 4 tables and a few stools by a counter. It WORKS. Food choices: Completely different than the unhealthy or routine options at other fast food places. Wood fire pizzas, delicious panini's and Mediterranean dishes. YUMMYMy husband had the chicken shawerma plate that he loved (he usually puts hot sauce on everything, but the taste and flavor of the chicken did not need any added sauce to change it up...so MIRACLE on my husband's side, Yay for Pi Hi's tasty chicken). I had the falafel plate which came with salad, rice, and hummus. So tasty.  I had their avocado panini a few days ago when my husband brought me dinner en route home from work. I LOVED it. They come with some home made marinated olives too which is better than a pickle in my eyes. ;-)Staff:Very friendly staff and work quickly and efficiently. Remember this is good food, not fast food so it takes a few minutes but they are quick. The owner is super friendly, professional and really has the customer's satisfaction at heart. Reasonable prices especially for the teens at Lane that want a healthier option than hot dogs and fries.  We will be back.

review_text: The first time my husband and I came here, we arrived about five minutes before closing.  I really hate going anywhere that soon before closing but we had just gotten back from a long trip to the burbs and had no food in the house.  It was a stormy night and you could tell the employees were ready to pack it in.  I expected to get a bad attitude from everyone inside.  Instead, they welcomed us in, told us to take our time looking at the menu and even gave us some free drinks.  Score!That was our first of many visits here and each time we have enjoyed not only tremendous service but also delicious food.  I have tried the falafel, the chicken combination plate and the beef plate.  They have all been wonderful.  Also, the portions are great and the prices are too.  I haven't tried the pizza yet but that's going to be my next adventure here.  Hope to see you there!

review_text: I am absolutely shocked that this place has such good ratings after my experience last night.  Maybe the quality of food and service is better when dining in the cafe, but the delivery was awful.  Whoever was the delivery man, he was incapable of buzzing himself into the building, did not carry a pen and delivered our food cold.  It started with the order.  The lady who assisted me was spaced out and needed to be repeated information 3 times.  Okay, decided to proceed since the menu looks great and the reviews were so complimentary.Ordered the following items, with reviews following each.- Mediterranean salad: Since when is this salad prepared solely with romaine lettuce, feta cheese, and toasted pita bread?  I found 2 small pieces of tomato and 1 piece of cucumber.  Really?  The feta cheese tasted like the cheap Athenos brand (dry, flavorless).  The dressing was off too.  Not sure where they picked up their recipe, but I'm pretty sure this salad is made with olive oil, vinegar, salt, peper and oregano.  God knows what was in that dressing, but it tasted weird.- Margherita "pizza" - If that's pizza, I must be eating something different at all other places.  Nevermind the fact that there were two specs (and I mean specs) of fresh mozzarella cheese, it arrived COMPLETELY COLD!  I live 5 minutes away from this place.  Why was the pizza cold?  If I wanted cold pizza, I would have eaten the leftovers.- Chicken Shawarma Plate and Falafel - The only reason why I am giving this place 2 stars.  Meat was pretty tasty, but the rice reminded me of Uncle Ben's rice and not something that's prepared in the cafe.  Hummus must also be the cheap, yuckie Athenos brand.  Falafel was good.I recommend Salam for Mediterranean and Pizza Art Cafe for pizza.  Avoid this place, despite the fact that they deliver.  Never ordering from this place again!

review_text: This is one of the BEST Mediterranean restaurant that I have ever been to. The food was great, the service was excellent, they give you a hefty portion, and they are reasonably priced. I ordered the Chicken Combo plate, which comes with chicken kabob, chicken schwarma, one falafel, salad, and pita bread. We also ordered a Godfather "pi", or flatbread and it was excellent; the fresh dough was the best part for me. I've been to at least 4 different Mediterranean places within a 2 mile radius of this place and hands down it is the best one. The owner came out to check on us several times and even let us try their olives that they marinate themselves. The olives were to die for; I could order jars of them. I will definitely be back here. The next time that I go I will try a smoothie and the lentil soup. I can't wait.

review_text: I came here when this place first opened when I moved to Chicago and have been meaning to write it up ever since. Better late than never, I suppose.  We ordered falafel, hummus, and beef & chicken schwarma.  The owner is incredibly friendly and proud of his establishment for obvious reasons.  The flavors in the food are very good as well as the portion:payment ratio.  You definitely get a good amount of food.  The falafel was crisp and delicious and the hummus was incredibly creamy with a pronounced tahini flavor (good in my opinion).  We've been meaning to go back and try their pizza since I think they have a brick oven there, but that'll have to be another review.

review_text: I cannot wait to come back to this place. My boyfriend and I came here for the AYCE pig roast over Memorial Day weekend and I can't believe it's taken me this long to profess my love for G&O.This review is strictly for the pig roast, as we didn't try any of their regular menu items, or any of their drinks/beer (had to save all our room for pig). However the pig roast was so freaking delicious I can only imagine how amazing their daily menu is. Literally some of the most delicious homemade BBQ sauce I've ever had. It was made with one of the featured beers which I now cannot remember. The pig was juicy, cooked to perfection, and served in bite-sized pieces. My first time EVER having collard greens, and they were so f*cking good I hope that's how they are all the time, otherwise this place has ruined all collard greens for me. Mac and cheese was amazing and I had helped myself to several servings of baked beans. My boyfriend went up to the buffet 3 separate times, coming back with full plates each time. After we left he didn't eat again for like 2 days cause he stuffed himself so full, no joke. Crowd is hipsterish, and not really my speed so I don't know if I could see myself here late night or anything, but OMG will we be back for lunch and dinner. Highly recommend, and can't wait to go back to try other Yelpers recommendations.

review_text: Such a cozy and humble little neighborhood hangout. My significant other and I were looking for something to eat, and I had remembered walking by this place a few times, so we stopped in. The ambiance is veryyy laid back. When we entered we were just told to "sit wherever", and eventually someone came by with menus and water. Groups of people were scattered throughout the space; some at the bar, some outside, some at tables, etc, and the lighting was dim. We came just a half an hour too late for the drink specials, but it seems like they offer great deals for Happy Hour. From the "Bigs" section of the menu, we ordered the duck and the shrimp. Both of us were pleased, and our waitress was great. Friendly, personable, patient, etc :)

review_text: I really like the ambiance and loved the music.....so I think I'll come back.I may have just stopped in at a bad time (10 pm Sunday night) but they have 2 major strikes:First off, stop comparing that burger to au cheval. The burger was super thin and the patty was charred. Not the good char, but charred to the point that you can taste burnt ash in your mouth. Alas, maybe it was just a bad time to order it. The fries were good though.Secondly, the crab fondue had IMITATION CRAB MEAT. I cannot. I despise imitation crab to the point that I don't even order it in restaurants that aren't at a particular price point. I thought it would be okay here because they have burrata, roasted sprouts, egg whites in their cocktails.......you know, seems like a place that would at least crack open a can of lump crab meat.The Mac and cheese was okay. Nothing bad to say about it.Like I said, I LOVED the space and the music so I'll probably be back on the half price food night to try other items on the menu.

review_text: Finally checking out this corner neighborhood spot! Having the day off of work I decided to check out G&O and figured Monday would be a great day considering their house special is 50 % off food! The outdoor patio was closed due to the rain on and off, I got a small table near  the bar. The staff were friendly and seemed to know their regulars by name which was nice to see. It was a bit dark a little more lightly would have be nice but I was sitting towards the back. Decided to go with the classic burger and fries. For a double stack burger it was just right I was full but not overly stuffed and the fries were fresh cut and super crisp and skinny. They have daily happy hr drink specials along with daily house specials. I'd like to check out the Mac and Cheese the next time I stop in! Great corner spot for a good burger especially if you're on a budget!

review_text: Stumbled on G&O while visiting Chicago and staying at an Air BnB in the area. It had good Yelp reviews and we were looking for a place just like this for dinner! A little more upscale in the food, and a little less meat-and-potatoes like most restaurants in Chicago.We tried a lot of the small plates, the pork pate' was soo good! It almost takes like tuna salad- definitely different, but really good. We also had the salad and fries and those were equally good.Loved the ambiance of the restaurant and our waitress was very nice and accommodating. We even got a free peach cobbler for my bf's birthday. G&O for the win! Great spot if your in the area.

review_text: Great little neighborhood spot!Went for brunch and it was great!It's a small space and dark so might be perfect if you're really hungover.  They had great bloody Mary's that they made anyway you liked...virgin, spicy, normal, side car, etc.Service was good.  Our girl was around and running between tables when she wasn't outside smoking.  HA!The food was really great...the only thing, was most of it was cold when it arrived at the table. I would've liked everything hotter though.Blt-YUMMY humongous sandwich with great bacon & all the fixingsBreakfast sandwich was great.  The jam really compliments the rest of the savory items on it.Crab bene-good but the least favB&G...I wished there was more biscuits. review_text: I've been looking for a cool, non-stuffy cocktail joint and I think I found it. G & O knocked my socks off. My first time experiencing fancy egg-white cocktails was in Nashville. If you've never tried them before, it might sound weird but they're fantastic. The mixologists here have created some really tasty selections and I wish I would have ordered more!My friend and I were here during the afternoon and it was nice and quiet. Our server was attentive and was happy to go into detail once we told him what we liked and didn't like.Since we were on our way to dinner, we didn't get to try the food but I'd love to come back for it. Maybe next time I won't walk out so lightheaded.
